programme.title: Big House, Little House
programme.desc: A couple in west London spend £70,000 to completely remodel the rear of their Victorian property, while in Manchester, another duo use £30,000 to treat themselves to an extension.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton shows a number of properties to Mena and Bal Patel, who want to buy a holiday home in Orihuela on the Costa Blanca in Spain.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Kent retirees David and Donna Bradley want to relocate permanently to Menorca, so Laura Hamilton shows them five properties for their £300,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps Linda and Alan Keir, who want to buy a holiday home to escape the climate of the Scottish Highlands. They look at five properties on their budget of £150,000.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Scarlette Douglas helps Martyn and Anne Golesworthy find a holiday home on the Greek island of Naxos, which holds a special place in their hearts as the place they got married.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin shows Southampton couple David and Sonia five fantastic properties for their budget of £100,000 in the Almeria province of southern Spain.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Sandra Dodsworth and husband Peter find a house in south Orlando so they can be closer to their daughter, who moved to Florida seven years ago.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: In the conclusion of Gordon Ramsay's visit to La Galleria 33 in Boston, Massachusetts, he confronts sisters Rita and Lisa with an ultimatum, and finds himself stuck in a war between the waiters, chefs and owners over who is to blame for the Italian restaurant's failings.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to New Orleans to visit Zeke's, a much-loved restaurant that has seen standards slip since the original owner died. The new proprietors, husband and wife duo Darryl and Ellen Cortello, focused all the efforts on the financial side of things, so it is up to Gordon to show them that they first need to love food to make any profit.(n)

programme.title: Paul O'Grady's Hollywood
programme.desc: The TV presenter continues his comprehensive exploration of the bombastic side of Hollywood, this time turning his attention to musical numbers that have elevated the popularity of their respective films. Over the years, Tinseltown musicals have touched on a wide variety of cinematic genres, from the family-friendly fantasies to urban dance and even more macabre territory via The Rocky Horror Picture Show. Here, Paul revisits Mary Poppins' tongue-twisting Supercalifragilisticexpialidocious, Pinball Wizard from Tommy, and a variety of numbers from Fame and Flashdance. He also sheds light on how Disney animation studios are keeping the musical genre alive, with blockbuster hits such as Frozen, which came complete with its own Oscar-winning girl-power anthem Let It Go. Includes contributions by Jonathan Ross, Celine Dion, Maureen Lipman and more.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two couples hoping to relocate to Surrey. Sonia and Daniel Alderson-Smith have a sizeable budget to find a new property in East Molesey - but have also decided there are only 18 streets on which they will consider living. Meanwhile, Phil offers advice to Maeve and Peter Dunne, who are unsure about which part of the county to move to.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer revisit their oldest-ever house-hunters, Margot and Henry from Berkshire, who were looking to move to somewhere a little more modern after 50 years in the same place. They also catch up with young couple Wendy and Simon, who were desperate to find their first home in Derby.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Headteacher Emma arrives in resus having been in a collision with a bus while cycling home from the school she works at. As she is treated, her husband Mick reflects on being informed what had happened. Meanwhile, 33-year-old Josh is treated for severe back pain, and 87-year-old Pamela is examined for a possible blood clot in her leg, and tells the doctors about her childhood in London during the Blitz.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: Following the criminalisation of formerly legal highs, crack and heroin use is on the up in Wiltshire - and some of the users seem to be getting younger and a routine stop and search uncovers a bag of crack cocaine in the possession of a boy still in his teens. Meanwhile, PC Luke Hobbs leads his first drugs raid on a suspected heroin and crack supplier in Swindon's city centre, discovering the property has been commandeered by a dealer from London who is using the address as a base to make a move into the local market.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: In the conclusion of Gordon Ramsay's visit to La Galleria 33 in Boston, Massachusetts, he confronts sisters Rita and Lisa with an ultimatum, and finds himself stuck in a war between the waiters, chefs and owners over who is to blame for the Italian restaurant's failings.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 22-year-old gym addict Sophie from Surrey, who is desperate to find a man who boasts a little banter. Next up is Dom, a 25-year-old wedding model from Bournemouth. He wants to find the perfect man to waltz him down the aisle and thinks people that can guarantee to do this are confident, daring and adventurous in their outlook.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The documentary follows Kirstine and Phil, who have not spent a day apart in four years, but following an emergency during labour the pair find themselves separated. Cameras also focus on independent businesswoman Tyla. While awaiting the arrival of her third child, she starts to reconsider her romantic future. And although Spanish nurses Carlota and Javier epitomise the perfect relationship, the pair realise that labour can be challenging even for the best of partnerships.(n)

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Phil Spencer and Kirstie Allsopp try to help a couple living in a flat on the River Thames in central London, who disagree on whether they should move. Gareth and Tina have owned the property for 10 years and Tina loves being within walking distance of work, schools, clubs and all the sights, but Gareth wants a big family home and Phil finds a detached house with a pool to tempt the family into the suburbs.(n)

programme.title: Big House, Little House
programme.desc: A couple in west London spend £70,000 to completely remodel the rear of their Victorian property, while in Manchester, another duo use £30,000 to treat themselves to an extension.(n)

programme.title: The Last Leg
programme.desc: Adam Hills, Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker are joined by environmentalist and former Vice President of the United States Al Gore for a comic review of the significant moments of the past seven days. The trio offer their own unique insight into some of the most difficult and delicate issues in modern Britain, and answer that most important of questions: Is it OK? Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Kirstie's Vintage Gems
programme.desc: Cheshire couple Iman and Heather Ahmed have a new house and want Kirstie Allsopp to help them decorate it with a vintage 1920s-inspired theme. She comes up with ways of helping Iman overcome his dislike of second-hand goods and shows him how to become creative with glass.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: High-end pawnbroker James tries to make an £85,000 deal on a modified sports car, while designer handbag expert Claudia heads to Germany to value a large collection of bags owned by a former New York socialite. A female bodybuilder wants to sell jewellery so she can fund her new hobby, and a golf fanatic brings in a case of vintage wine.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: High-end pawnshop boss James test drives a home-made electric bike, while the Prestige Pawnbrokers team are put to the test when a £30,000 diamond ring arrives with the wrong paperwork. Meanwhile, a bespoke DJ van comes to HQ with a large price tag, and a bishop wants to sell a Salvador Dali sculpture to fund his children's charity in Kenya.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer's latest mission takes them to Sussex, where they help to solve two different house-hunting problems. Ashlee Newton has been saving for nine years to buy her first home, and is looking for a period flat near the bars and restaurants of Brighton or Hove. Colin Amery and Robin Balance are getting ready to move in together for the first time, and want to find a property they can renovate from scratch - which means they are paying particular attention to architectural details.(n)

programme.title: Double Your House for Half the Money
programme.sub-title: Sarah Beeny's Double Your House for Half the Money.
programme.desc: The property developer visits Great Baddow in Essex, where Ian and Claire hope to double the size of their four-bedroom house and make it a multi-generational home with separate floors for their parents, children and themselves. Sarah also meets Paul and Mimi, who relocated from London after the riots of summer 2011. They are now settled in Great Bowden, Leicestershire, and hope to extend and rework the original layout of their 1960s home.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay travels to Oceana, a restaurant in the heart of New Orleans, to try to change the fortunes of a business run by two quarrelling brothers. The chef soon discovers that the ingredients are of poor quality and could pose a health hazard, but he struggles to make his point with the owners without causing an even bigger conflict between them.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at No 33 in Hunstanton, Norfolk, where owner Janie Thompson and housekeeper Gemma Layfield hope their quirky design and brand of luxury will win the day.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The culinary contest arrives in Hull as five more diners hope to claim the grand prize of £1,000. The first to host a party this week is 29-year-old welfare team leader Jennie, who decides to honour her home city's fishing history with an under-the-sea themed dinner. However, her guests prove to be a lively bunch, twerking their way through dinner, and throwing in a few seal impressions along the way.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Wrestling promoter and novice cook James hosts the second night in Hull, and he hopes to wow his guests with a Mexican-themed party complete with a wrestling match as the evening's entertainment. However, his costume requirements, and his spicy food, may be too much for some of the attendees.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Wedding stationery entrepreneur Katrena hosts the third dinner party in Hull, and hopes to impress her guests with a cruise-ship-themed night featuring a pink strawberry soup starter, a sparkling lemon iceberg dessert and towel-folding entertainment.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mum-of-three Natalie hopes that her choice of good quality produce can help her to impress her guests on the fourth night of the competition in Hull, East Yorkshire. However, the evening does not get off to the best start when community manager George wrongly guesses that she is the grandmother of her two-year-old daughter, and entrepreneur Katrena is insulted by one of the host's questions.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the final dinner party in Hull and the turn of community manager George to entertain the guests. Having spent the week heavily criticising everyone else's cooking, the host faces great scrutiny with his menu of simple yet tasty favourites. It remains to be seen whether his egg drop soup and flambeed crepes Suzettes live up to expectations, before the winner of the cash prize is revealed.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer visit the Tees Valley in the north-east of England to find a property for first-time parents Nicola Moore and Tony Curry, who are desperate for a place together. They also offer expert advice to jewellery designer Emily Lathan and her graphic-designer boyfriend Dani Jones.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps Linda and Alan Keir, who want to buy a holiday home to escape the climate of the Scottish Highlands. They look at five properties on their budget of £150,000.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Scarlette Douglas comes to the aid of Neil Masey and Affy Wajid, a Brighton-based couple seeking to pick up a holiday home on Ibiza. The pair hope that setting up house will allow them to enjoy the island's party lifestyle, while also having a place where they can entertain friends and begin their explorations of the Mediterranean landscape.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer and Kirstie Allsopp catch up with Amy and Takie, who were desperate to buy their first property in London, but had to put their dream on hold until they could save enough to make buying worthwhile. There is also an update on Vicky and Andy, who combined their search for a home and two businesses in Wiltshire on a budget of £400,000 - an idea they eventually reconsidered when the reality of the market became clear.(n)

programme.title: Princess Diana's `Wicked' Stepmother
programme.desc: An examination of the turbulent relationship between Diana, Princess of Wales and her formidable stepmother Raine Spencer, who rose from humble origins with the help of her larger-than-life mother, the novelist Barbara Cartland, to become a countess and a member of the royal family. Raine was a divisive figure, who was doted on by her husband Johnnie Spencer but loathed by Diana and her siblings. Yet as the princess's marriage collapsed, she reached out to her stepmother for support, marking a change in the women's relationship.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The best and funniest moments from the recent series, including armchair TV reviews of Culinary Genius, Britain's Got Talent, Line of Duty, Cruising with Jane McDonald, University Challenge and First Dates. Plus, news reports featuring Diane Abbott, squirrels and young children gate-crashing a serious interview.(n)

programme.title: My Online Nightmare
programme.desc: This documentary explores some of the most extraordinary scammers and fraudsters who use the internet to lure and con their victims with terrifying, and sometimes deadly, results. This first episode examines astonishing cases of sex fraud, telling the stories of people who were tricked into thinking that the person they met online were someone completely different.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.desc: The documentary revisits individuals featured in previous episodes to see how they are getting on. Rob is 45 and has been on the dole for 20 years. He has lost his case for compensation against the council after an accident outside a shop, but refuses to give up and is seeking damages from the shop owner instead. The film also catches up with a family from Whitby who include a father with Tourette's and an autistic son, and single parent Matt who lives in Cowes on the Isle of Wight with his two sons.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.desc: The documentary revisits individuals featured in previous episodes to see how they have been getting on. While some have been battling eviction and family break-ups, for others things have changed for the better. From dole-claiming ex-soap stars to people who use their benefits to pay for their pets, the day-to-day reality of life on the dole is revealed.(n)

programme.title: Australia
programme.desc: In northern Australia at the beginning of World War II, an English aristocrat inherits a cattle station the size of Maryland. When English cattle barons plot to take her land, she reluctantly joins forces with a rough-hewn stock-man to drive 2,000 head of cattle across hundreds of miles of the country's most unforgiving land, only to still face the bombing of Darwin, Australia, by the Japanese forces that had attacked Pearl Harbor only months earlier(n)

programme.title: Reign Of Fire
programme.desc: A survivalist (Christian Bale) teams up with a military man (Matthew McConaughey) to slay fire-breathing dragons in postapocalyptic 2020(n)

programme.title: National Security
programme.desc: The mismatched cops variation of the buddy comedy genre gets taken out of mothballs for this farce directed by longtime Adam Sandler collaborator Dennis Dugan. Martin Lawrence and Steve Zahn star, respectively, as Earl Montgomery, a loudmouthed police academy reject, and Hank Rafferty, a mild-mannered cop who is disgraced and dismissed from his job. Having met once before on a traffic stop, the two men are less than thrilled to be paired together as security guards. When the two men discover a complex smuggling scheme, however, they put aside their animosity to investigate the criminal scheme. They soon learn that the illegal enterprise involves a mastermind named Nash (Eric Roberts) and a new, virtually indestructible metal that's worth a fortune. Unable to persuade Hank's former police department superiors that they're onto a huge case, the two partners must devise a way to expose the sophisticated scam and bring down Nash on their own. National Security co-stars Colm Feore, Bill Duke, Timothy Busfield, and Wayne Knight(n)

programme.title: Kindergarten Cop
programme.desc: Arnie's at his best as tough L.A. detective John Kimble who must find a drug lord's wife so she can testify in court. Problem is, she's gone into hiding to protect her son. With only the name of the kid's elementary school, Kimble must go undercover... As a kindergarten teacher! Academy Award winner Linda Hunt joins the cast with Academy Award nominee Cathy Moriarty in this great blend of action, thrills, and humor(n)

programme.title: The Intern
programme.desc: A 70-year-old widower comes out of retirement to take an internship at a trendy start-up fashion company, and unexpectedly becomes a confidant for the overwhelmed young CEO(n)

programme.title: A Serious Man
programme.desc: Meek physics professor Larry Gopnic finds his life unravelling as he deals with his cheating wife, his layabout brother, his disobedient children, threats to his tenure and a next-door neighbour who likes to sunbathe in the nude(n)

programme.title: Doctor Detroit
programme.desc: An ineffectual professor (Dan Aykroyd) becomes involved with the underworld when he is forced to go undercover as a pimp. As it turns out, the life rather suits "Dr. Detroit," and he becomes a minor celebrity(n)

programme.title: Point Break
programme.desc: An undercover FBI agent infiltrates a group of extreme athletes who are using their specialized skills to pull off a series of complex crimes. Remake of the 1991 cult hit of the same name(n)

programme.title: Stir of Echoes: The Homecoming
programme.desc: Rob Lowe and Shawn Roberts star in this sequel following an Iraq War veteran who is plagued by terrifying visions after returning home(n)

programme.title: The Ninth Gate
programme.desc: Eerie saga about a rare-book buyer who becomes a target of unknown forces when he's asked to find a volume about the Devil(n)

programme.title: Freeheld
programme.desc: Emotional docudrama about terminally ill New Jersey police officer Laurel Hester, whose 2005 legal battle for the right to pass her pension benefits on to her female life partner became an equal-rights milestone(n)

programme.title: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
programme.desc: Director Peter Weir's first turn behind the camera since 1998's critically acclaimed The Truman Show, Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World is based on two Napoleonic War-era adventure novels in author Patrick O'Brian's Aubrey/Maturin series, Master and Commander and The Far Side of the World. Russell Crowe stars as Captain Jack Aubrey, a high-seas adventurer who maintains a strong bond with ship-surgeon Stephen Maturin (Paul Bettany). After conquering much of Europe already, Napoleon's forces have set their sights on taking Britain, so Aubrey and the crew of his ship, the HMS Surprise, take to the Pacific to intercept any attacking ships from the French fleet. When Aubrey eyes a renegade French super-frigate, the Surprise pursues, leading to an adrenaline-charged chase through the distant reaches of the sea. Edward Woodall, James D'Arcy, and Lee Ingleby also star as members of the Surprise's crew(n)

programme.title: The Terminator
programme.desc: Endlessly imitated, The Terminator made the reputation of cowriter/director James Cameron -- who would go on to make 1997's titanic Titanic -- and solidified the stardom of Arnold Schwarzenegger. The movie begins in a post-apocalyptic 2029, when Los Angeles has been largely reduced to rubble and is under the thumb of all-powerful ruling machines. Kyle Reese (Michael Biehn), a member of the human resistance movement, is teleported back to 1984. His purpose: to rescue Sarah Connor (Linda Hamilton), the mother of the man who will lead the 21st-century rebels against the tyrannical machines, from being assassinated before she can give birth. Likewise thrust back to 1984 is The Terminator (Schwarzenegger), a grim, well-armed, virtually indestructable cyborg who has been programmed to eliminate Sarah Connor. After killing two "Sarah Connors" who turn out to be the wrong women, he finally aims his gunsights at the genuine article. This is the film in which Schwarzenegger declared "I'll be baaaack" -- and back he was, in "kinder and gentler" form, in the even more successful Terminator 2: Judgment Day (1991)(n)

programme.title: Morgan
programme.desc: A mysterious artificial being evolves faster than anticipated, and a corporate consultant is enlisted to determine the test subject's fate(n)

programme.title: From Hell
programme.desc: Johnny Depp stars in this intense psychological spin on the horrific legend of Jack the Ripper(n)

programme.title: The Purge: Election Year
programme.desc: In the third installment of this horror series about a night when all crime is legal, a former police sergeant (Frank Grillo) who refused to murder his son's killer must now act as the head of security for a presidential candidate (Elizabeth Mitchell) who wants to end "the Purge." Written and directed by James DeMonaco(n)

programme.sub-title: If at First You Don't Succeed, Lie, Lie Again.
programme.desc: Adam Carolla comes to the aid of a couple whose small house needed emergency renovation on a retaining wall to prevent it sliding down a hill, and who also hoped to expand there living space with a deck - but were deceived by the contractor they hired to carry out the job.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The body of a celebrity is found at a party and the team discovers links with a mysterious gambling ring offering participants the chance to bet on the dates of famous people's deaths. Further investigation leads the officers to an offshore operation producing high-quality counterfeit banjoes. The forensic spin-off show's 100th episode, starring David Caruso and Emily Procter.(n)

programme.title: Two Wrongs
programme.desc: Nurse and single mother Sarah struggles to balance her work and home life, but her worst nightmare is realised when her daughter Lauren is abducted while walking home alone from school and she faces a moral dilemma if she is to save her child. Thriller, starring Gillian Zinser.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: Any Old Port in a Storm
programme.desc: A vineyard owner's financial security is jeopardised when his playboy younger brother threatens to sell the family winery. He resorts to killing his sibling and rigging the death scene to look like a scuba-diving accident. However, the crumpled cop sees through the ruse and in the process reveals he is something of a wine buff himself. Detective drama, with Peter Falk, Donald Pleasence and Julie Harris.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: Negative Reaction
programme.desc: A successful photographer wants to get rid of his nagging wife so he can pursue an affair with his assistant. He murders his spouse and makes it look as if she was killed by a kidnapper, and at the same time puts an ex-con in the frame. However, the dogged detective sees through his ruse and proceeds to pick the story to pieces. Crime drama, with Peter Falk, Dick Van Dyke, Don Gordon and Antoinette Bower.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: Troubled Waters
programme.desc: The slovenly sleuth sets out on a pleasure cruise to Acapulco. However, one of the passengers is planning to kill his lover to stop her blackmailing him, and has arranged a cast-iron alibi. But when the crime is discovered, the captain looks to Columbo to solve the mystery. Drama, starring Peter Falk, Robert Vaughn, Dean Stockwell, Patrick Macnee and Poupee Bocar.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A US Marine, a waitress and a chef are shot dead at a diner, in what is thought to be a bungled robbery. However, when the team arrives to investigate, a previously unknown witness emerges from the eatery's freezer, claiming the killer had an unusual tattoo. The statement rings alarm bells for LaSalle, who realises the circumstances of the killings match those of his first-ever case with Pride 10 years earlier, which remained unsolved after Hurricane Katrina devastated the crime scene. Convinced their killer has struck again, he and Pride work together once again in an attempt to achieve closure once and for all. Naval crime drama, starring Lucas Black and Scott Bakula.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A string of house robberies at Christmas takes a bloody turn when one of the victims, a Navy Commander's wife, is found dead at the scene. Among the items stolen is a laptop containing sensitive data, and the team is able to track the computer to a moving car. However, when the police intercept the driver, it turns out to be none other than Dr Wade's adopted son Danny. Naval crime drama, guest starring Christoper Meyer.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: A millionaire former CIA man meets a premature end when someone plants a controlled explosive in his lighter. Over the years he had built up an impressive list of enemies, so finding his killer looks like an uphill task, but as the agents start working through the potential culprits, a recovered computer file leads them to an escort service used by a wanted hitman. However, what they don't bank on is the chief suspect turning up dead.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Mac uncovers a murder on board a commercial flight from New York to Washington DC and sets up a makeshift crime lab to catch the killer. The case takes an unexpected twist with the discovery that the victim, an escaped convict with a history of drug-running, was posing as a federal air marshal to smuggle cash out of the country.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Evidence found at a murder scene links the victim to a number of high-profile figures, including police chief Brigham Sinclair and the benefactor who made Hawkes' career possible. The detectives learn the killer stole a data stick, but find their inquiries hindered by a private investigator trying to suppress sensitive information about his employer. Crime drama, starring Gary Sinise, Melina Kanakaredes and Mykelti Williamson.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Stabler and Benson investigate the death of an astronaut whose body is discovered in the Hudson River. They identify two chief suspects - a drug addict who used the murdered woman's credit card and a man who was barred from the space programme after fighting with the victim. However, a shooting at the precinct jeopardises the detectives' chances of solving the case. Crime drama, guest starring James Brolin, with Christopher Meloni, Mariska Hargitay and Dann Florek.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The detectives call on the help of Dr Warner when the death of a baby leads Stabler and Benson to crack down on a doctor who claims that Aids does not exist and whose dubious practices have cost several lives. Guest starring Babs Olusanmokun (The Unit, Life on Mars).(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Stabler and Munch investigate when a homeless teenager is found burned to death outside a restaurant. The victim's father tells them there could be a link with some violent videos uploaded to the internet, so the team sets up a sting operation which eventually leads them to the same school the dead man had attended - and two groups of girls who are very single-minded.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A dead bird is found in a murdered model's bag, leading the detectives to believe it is a coded Mob message, but as they investigate further, her sister believes a rapper called Gots Money is responsible for the crime. However, when tiger saliva is discovered on the victim's body, Stabler is forced to go undercover to confront a former people trafficker who is now involved in the exotic animal trade. Crime drama, guest starring Caitlin Fitzgerald and Outkast singer Antwan Andre Patton.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A woman claims to have been raped by a stranger to hide the fact she is a victim of domestic abuse, but later admits that her husband has been beating her because she does not want children with him. While conducting inquiries, Benson stumbles on a shockingly similar case involving the victim's elderly neighbour. Crime drama, starring Mariska Hargitay.(n)

programme.title: Catch a Contractor

In the first episode, they meet members of a family forced to sleep on their living room floor after a builder rips their home apart and deserts the project. The team tries to track down the contractor and make him return to the scene of the crime to repair the damage.(n)

programme.desc: A traumatised marine escapes from a psychiatric unit, convinced he is still fighting in Iraq. programme.title: The Sixth Sense
programme.desc: (1999) M Night Shyamalan's chiller about a boy who has the not-entirely-welcome ability to directly contact the dead. Bruce Willis stars as child psychologist Dr Malcolm Crowe, who is asked to help Cole Sear (Haley Joel Osment), who claims he can 'see dead people'. Crowe is sceptical at first, but - prompted partly by a past case he felt he badly let down - he's gradually convinced that the boy is telling the truth. Crowe believes that actively engaging with the ghostly presences could help both Sear and the spirits to find peace. Overcoming his terror, the lad finds that communicating with the deceased does, at first, seem to be beneficial. But then matters take on their own momentum, leading to one of the director's trademark plot twists... Also starring Toni Collette. M,W,S,(n)

programme.title: The Three Stooges
programme.desc: From Nurse to Worse. Written by former Buster Keaton gag man (Clyde Bruckman, this typical Three Stooges 2-reeler centered on Curly (Curly Howard, who is forced to act insane in order to collect on an insurance -- not too difficult a task for the infantile Stooge. Pretending to be a dog, Curly is delivered to the insurance doctor on a leash, but the good doc insists on performing a cerebrum decapitation on his patient and the Stooges flee on a runaway gurney. One of the busiest starlets in the Stooges stock company, Dorothy Appleby, headed the supporting cast which also included black comic Dudley Dickerson, former boxer Cy Schindell, the formidable-looking Blanche Payson and sour-faced Ned Glass (in his second of two early Stooges appearances). The latter became one of the victims of the insidious Hollywood "red scare" blacklist, but his friendship with Moe Howard led to work in such Stooge comedies as Hokus Pokus (1949) and Three Hams on Rye (1954)(n)

programme.title: Slither
programme.desc: A strange and very slimy alien invasion takes on a small country community in this horror story. Wheelsy is a small rural town where not much happens, but that's about to change, and not for the better. Grant Grant (Michael Rooker), the town's wealthiest and most powerful citizen, is taking a walk through the woods when he comes across a strange and unfamiliar life form. Grant makes the mistake of getting too close to it, and soon an otherworldly creature has taken over his body. It isn't long before Grant isn't the only one who has been attacked by the strange and slimy things, as a local girl and a handful of house pets go missing. Grant's wife, Starla (Elizabeth Banks), notices that something is very wrong with her husband around the same time that Sheriff Bill Pardy (Nathan Fillion) becomes aware of the pattern of missing people and animals, and they set out to put a stop to the alien invaders intent upon taking over Wheelsy. Slither was the directorial debut for James Gunn, who wrote the screenplay for the 2004 remake of Dawn of the Dead(n)

programme.title: The Goonies
programme.desc: Old-fashioned yarn about a band of adventurous kids who take on the might of a property-developing company which plans to destroy their home to build a country club. But the old pirate who drew the map also planted a number of dangerous obstacles along the way(n)

programme.title: Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides
programme.desc: Flamboyant seafarer Jack Sparrow (Johnny Depp) lands himself in a bit of a bind after being lured onto Blackbeard's (Ian McShane) ship by enigmatic siren Angelica (Penélope Cruz), and forced to seek out the Fountain of Youth. Trapped on the Queen Anne's Revenge with the most nefarious pirate in history, Captain Jack reflects on his past with the elusive Angelica while embarking on his wildest adventure to date. The Rhea-M comet starts revolving round earth and provokes all machinery to become their own masters and revolt against mankind. Anwar is being held as a suspected terrorist in secrecy in Marrakech, where CIA operative Douglas Freeman is reluctantly involved in his torture. programme.desc: Black Bear Bow Hunt. While others are occupied planting crops while spring is in season, Atz is off in search of a black bear armed with only his bow to replenish his supply of meat for the coming winter(n)

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier: The Frozen Edge
programme.desc: Just for the Halibut. The cows are grazing in the throes of spring, but will need to be redirected from eating crops with some frontier ingenuity. Meanwhile, Jane realizes she has company on a fishing trip for halibut(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents action from the opening round of Premier League fixtures, including Watford v Liverpool, Chelsea v Burnley and Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester City. Liverpool defeated the Hornets 1-0 in last season's corresponding fixture thanks to Emre Can's Match of the Day Goal of the Season-winner and will have expected another tough encounter. Meanwhile, Chelsea will have expected to get their title-defence off to a winning start and newly promoted Brighton faced a difficult task against Pep Guardiola's expensively assembled side.(n)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Emma Barnett present topical debate covering religious, moral and ethical issues, with guest panellists and contributions from viewers.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin explore properties about to be auctioned in Catford, London, in Liverpool, near the river Mersey, and in Alvaston, Derby.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Extended edition in which a red team of singers and a blue team of multi-instrumentalists join experts Catherine Southon and Paul Laidlaw at an antiques fair in Edinburgh, followed by an auction in Glasgow, where Anita Manning has her gavel in hand. Meanwhile, Presenter Tim Wonnacott heads to Plympton in Devon to visit Saltram House.(n)

programme.title: Wanted Down Under
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps Lisa Hoffman and her husband Math decide whether to move to Australia by showing them a selection of properties in Brisbane. Lisa believes she can enjoy a more adventurous life in the city and Math is impressed by the homes that are within their budget, but he is doubtful that he will be able to leave his friends and family in Wales behind.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Continent
programme.desc: Anita Rani goes house-hunting with a buyer from Hertfordshire who is seeking a retreat for himself and paying guests in the southern Spanish province of Almeria. Along the way, Anita gives advice on the practicalities of moving to Spain, and takes to the water at a Roman baths.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: People are invited to try to make money out of their antiques by taking a risk at auction.(n)

programme.title: Super Small Animals
programme.desc: Patrick Aryee investigates the world of miniature creatures, from a primate no bigger than a mouse to a chameleon that can fit on a human fingertip, finding out what makes them some of the most successful animals on the planet. He reveals how the smallest armadillo manages to control its temperature in the searing desert sun, and meets a scientist who studies how really tiny spiders have a surprising trick that enables them to travel an incredible 40 miles a day using almost no energy.(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Josie D'Arby attends the New Wine gathering in Somerset, and Connie Fisher visits Abbey Road studios to celebrate the 50th anniversary of the Beatles recording All You Need Is Love.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Anita Rani and Sean Fletcher present an episode exploring Dartmoor. Anita takes a trip along a trail that connects local artists and crafts people, meeting a blacksmith and learning to spin wool using traditional methods, while Sean investigates how unwanted Dartmoor pony foals that would normally be culled at birth can instead be used in therapy for people with learning difficulties.(n)

programme.title: Fake or Fortune
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and art expert Philip Mould investigate a portrait of a man wearing a black cravat painted in 1939, which the owner believes is an early work of Lucian Freud, from his time at the Central School of Art - even though Freud himself denied painting it. The team tries to uncover who the mysterious man in the painting was, whether it really was painted by Freud, and if so, why did he claim that it was not his work. The investigation digs up a complex history of feuds, rivalry and intrigue.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents further coverage of the 10th and concluding evening at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, featuring the finals of four more events. Asbel Kibrop and Caster Semenya will be among the favourites in the respective men's 1500m and women's 800m finals, before attention switches to the men's and women's 4x400m relays, both of which Great Britain will be hopeful of winning medals in should they be involved. With commentary by Steve Cram, Brendan Foster, Andrew Cotter and Steve Backley, and analysis from Michael Johnson, Denise Lewis and Colin Jackson.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents action from this afternoon's fixtures - Newcastle United v Tottenham Hotspur at St James' Park and Manchester United v West Ham United at Old Trafford. Newly promoted Newcastle faced a difficult task against last term's runners-up. Meanwhile the Red Devils, will have expected to get off to a winning start against the Hammers after another summer of heavy investment, though Slaven Bilic has also strengthened his side considerably.(n)

programme.title: Brendan Foster: A Life in Athletics
programme.desc: An insight into the career of the broadcaster and former athlete, who won gold as a long distance runner at the European Championships and Commonwealth Games in the 1970s, before going on to become a commentator. Foster has covered nine Olympic Games during his time with the BBC, and is due to retire following the IAAF World Championships, which begin on Friday.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Wanted Down Under
programme.desc: Belfast man Gavin Butterworth dreams of moving to Adelaide and starting his own wine business. But persuading wife Tracey, who is settled in her work, could prove tricky.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Lucy Alexander and Dion Dublin meet the new owners of a pair of semi-detached cottages in Lincolnshire, a bungalow in Cheshire and a property in Kent.(n)

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: A woman has an emotional reunion with her niece after being estranged for 30 years, while another case reveals links to 19th-century Whitechapel and the Jack the Ripper murders.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: Two best friends adrift in the North Sea pledge to look after each others families if they don't make it out alive, and a young British teacher in China waiting for a takeaway is hit full on by a speeding driver, who crashes through the wall of the restaurant at high speed. Alex Jones presents.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Ben Cooper and Gary Pe help two teams find items at Peterborough's East of England Showground, while presenter Natasha Raskin Sharp tries her hand at glass-blowing in Stourbridge.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: Angela's lies and Tommy's secrets attract scrutiny, while an ambitious Bridget has business in mind and Sharon agonises over confessing all to Paudge.(n)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts a game show in which the same 30 players compete for a daily prize of up to £1,500 and the chance to win £10,000. Every right answer takes them a step closer to a shot at that jackpot - but a single `impossible' answer knocks them out for the day.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin goes property-hunting with a couple from Stevenage, Hertfordshire, who are seeking an authentic country lifestyle in Suffolk and a rural family home.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: People are invited to try to make money out of their antiques by taking a risk at auction.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: The first visit of the week to the One Show studio, where Matt Baker and Alex Jones present the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat.(n)

programme.title: Scotland's Model Teenager
programme.desc: Documentary following the story of 18-year-old Glaswegian Connor Newall as he travels in Europe and to New York on various modelling assignments, examining his fast-paced life in the fashion world and also looking at whether his home life in Govan is moving on without him. Agents, family and professionals provide guidance as the teenage model tries to keep the momentum going and survive and thrive in the sometimes superficial world of fashion. Part of the Our Lives strand.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil receives an unexpected offer on the car lot land, making him realise the time has come to do right by his family. With the Vic in need of staff, Linda gives Keanu a trial shift, much to the annoyance of Fi. Carmel invites Max on holiday, but he leaves her hanging while he secretly consults with Fi, and Jane informs Ian there is no chance Kathy is joining them in their new home.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Tina Daheley investigates the growing number of British passengers taking flights while inebriated, meeting whistleblowers from the airline industry who reveal just how badly our journeys are being disrupted. With new figures showing a rise in drink-related incidents and arrests, she asks how some airlines are fighting the problem and meets a Majorcan official sick of Brits arriving on her island already drunk.(n)

programme.title: Anne Robinson's Britain
programme.sub-title: Britain's Relationship Secrets with Anne Robinson.
programme.desc: The broadcaster looks at the ingredients of a happy relationship, meeting five couples from very different backgrounds who think they have the answer. She finds out how one pair survived an affair, whether marrying the lord of the manor is all it's cracked up to be and if agreeing to an arranged marriage can hold the key to long-term happiness. She also gets two couples to delve into one another's relationships to see what they can learn.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got Old News for You
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts an edition of the satirical current affairs quiz from November 2016, with Labour Party MP Jess Phillips and comedian Nish Kumar joining regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You.
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc hosts an extended edition of the satirical current affairs quiz from December 2016, with Citizen Khan star Adil Ray and Conservative MP Jacob Rees-Mogg joining captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's news.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: A to Z of TV Gardening
programme.desc: Carol Kirkwood looks back on her alphabetical journey through the world of horticulture, picking out her favourite tips from fellow presenters. The series progressed in order from A to Z, featuring gardening themes beginning with all 26 letters.(n)

programme.title: The Instant Gardener
programme.desc: Presenter Helen Skelton and expert garden designer Danny Clarke transform a tiny back yard into a beach garden inspired by the neighbouring Barry coastline.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don gives advice on how to cut and maintain hedges as well as ideas on growing fruit in pots, while Adam Frost uncovers the secrets of successful planting combinations in an Oxfordshire garden. Carol Klein chooses varieties of late flowering clematis as her plant of the month, Nick Bailey travels to the southern tip of Cornwall to seek out a plant which escaped from our gardens and is now threatening rare and native plants, and Mark Lane joins the enthusiasts who have lovingly restored a walled garden in Warwick. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Ellie Harrison investigates the role flowers and plants play in everyday life. She visits a herb garden in Bristol to find out about a common plant that is useful in treating cancer, meets a dye maker who only uses natural plant and flower-based colours, discovers a special kind of pickling, and joins a class of schoolchildren who are cultivating rare orchids.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Nadiya's British Food Adventure
programme.desc: Nadiya Hussain samples what London has to offer, heading to Beckton in the east of the city to visit an indoor urban farm in an industrial estate that uses hydroponics and aquaponics to rear fish and grow vegetables. She then heads north to Holloway, to meet chef Pratap Chatal, who runs supper clubs in his home where he showcases his revolutionary idea of cooking his food with fragrances.(n)

programme.title: Lorraine's Fast, Fresh and Easy Food
programme.desc: Lorraine Pascale demonstrates simple dishes completely from scratch, ideal for today's hectic world where, for many, packet and microwave meals have become the norm. She has solutions for all occasions, beginning with ideas for easy entertaining when friends or family turn up out of the blue and reveals how it is possible to spend less time in the kitchen and more time having fun with everyone else.(n)

programme.title: MOTD2 Extra
programme.desc: Mark Chapman and guests review yesterday's Premier League fixtures and look ahead to Newcastle United v Tottenham Hotspur and Manchester United v West Ham United.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents coverage of day 10 at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, featuring the men's 20km walk. Great Britain's Tom Bosworth will be hoping to contend here, having recently broken the mile walk world record at the Anniversary Games. Live coverage begins on the interactive service at 7.40am.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Ancient Capital: Secrets of Orkney
programme.desc: Andy Torbet and local seafaring volunteers build a boat made of just willow and cow hide, and set out to cross the dangerous Pentland Firth as the ancient Orcadians would have done. Neil Oliver investigates the extraordinary discovery of some human bones, Chris Packham goes in search of whales and Shini Somara uncovers the powers of the tides.(n)

programme.title: Steve Backshall's Extreme Mountain Challenge
programme.desc: Part two of two. The naturalist reaches the peak of one of Venezuela's tepui mountains, before joining a party of Italian cavers as they venture into the unexplored caverns within. Inside, they discover strange wildlife and evidence of the geological forces that give the tepuis their unusual shape. Finally, the team returns to the ground by abseiling down the Angel Falls, the world's highest waterfall.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.sub-title: World Athletics Championships 2017: Day 10 - Evening Session.
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents coverage of the 10th and concluding evening at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park. Great Britain's Robbie Grabarz and Laura Muir will hope to be involved in the respective high jump and 5,000m finals, and medals are also decided in the women's discus. With commentary by Steve Cram, Brendan Foster, Andrew Cotter and Steve Backley, and analysis from Michael Johnson, Denise Lewis and Colin Jackson. Coverage continues on BBC1.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Part two of two. Jamie Bartlett investigates the impact of technology on democracy, revealing how aspects of social media designed to benefit the advertising industry by gathering personal data about users can be used to influence voters and spread misinformation. Featuring contributions from a key insider on Donald Trump's presidential campaign.(n)

programme.title: This World
programme.sub-title: North Korea: Murder in the Family.
programme.desc: Documentary examining the murder of the North Korean dictator's half-brother Kim Jong-nam at Kuala Lumpur airport. The programme examines the activities of North Korean secret agents at the airport on the day of the killing, and reports on a powerful international business network that has allowed the Kim dynasty to remain in power for nearly 70 years.(n)

programme.title: Golf: USPGA Championship
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour presents live coverage of the closing stages of the fourth and concluding day at the fourth and final Major of the year, held at Quail Hollow Club in Charlotte, North Carolina. Commentary from Peter Alliss, Ken Brown, Maureen Madill and Mark James. Live coverage begins on the interactive service at 7.00pm.(n)

programme.title: The Body
programme.desc: A police inspector is called in to investigate the unexplained disappearance of a body from a morgue, with the only witness to the crime a security guard who is now in a coma. The detective becomes convinced that the dead woman's husband has something to hide, and while he protests his innocence, his personal demons soon overwhelm him. Thriller, starring Jose Coronado and Hugo Silva. In Spanish.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Ellie Harrison investigates the role flowers and plants play in everyday life. She visits a herb garden in Bristol to find out about a common plant that is useful in treating cancer, meets a dye maker who only uses natural plant and flower-based colours, discovers a special kind of pickling, and joins a class of schoolchildren who are cultivating rare orchids.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Bernie is confronted with an impossible situation when a trauma patient forces her to consider what she wants out of life. Ollie and Zosia are made an offer they cannot refuse, but it may be too good to be true. Meanwhile, Lofty has fallen out of favour with Dom. Can he win him round?.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Kate Garraway looks back at significant small-screen shows from her past, revealing which finger puppets hold a special place in her heart, the daytime programme that helped her fall in love with TV and the fashion drama that had a huge influence on her as a teenager. She also talks about her big break, when the nation woke up to her presenting alongside Eamonn Holmes.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park Summer Special
programme.desc: Ben Fogle catches up with a pregnant anteater that is due any day, one of the keepers prepares to leave and vets try to find out what is wrong with a much-loved tapir. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents from Newark, where he goes deep underground to discover a fascinating piece of local history, while Philip Serrell and Charles Hanson help the teams.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: Lawrence puts the squeeze on a finance company that has not paid its rent, and the officers deal with squatters in a former garden centre in central London. Ken goes in search of money owed to a family whose front door was ruined by a botched repair - only to get locked in.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents a quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: A Taste of Britain
programme.desc: Janet Street-Porter and Brian Turner travel to Cheshire, where they start their tour of the county overlooking the countryside from Alderley Edge before doing a spot of trout fishing. A trip to a smokehouse inspires Brian's first recipe - smoked trout pate - while Janet heads down a historic copper mine. At the Lord Clyde pub, the duo meet chef Ernst van Zyl, who prepares a dish for Janet, before the duo enjoy a visit to Tatton Park.(n)

programme.title: I Bought a Rainforest
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Charlie Hamilton James has bought 100 acres of the Peruvian rainforest, a strategic purchase he hopes will stop loggers entering the Manu National Park and illegally cutting down trees. In the first edition, he establishes camp and gets his bearings, only to discover he has not bought the pristine virgin rainforest of his dreams, but instead an area of secondary forest complete with a squatter, cocaine crops and evidence suggesting that he may have some dangerous neighbours.(n)

programme.title: Monkey Planet
programme.desc: Zoologist George McGavin explores the world of primates, from strange lemurs and acrobatic monkeys to enigmatic apes. He uncovers the secrets of the primates' success - their survival tactics and physical adaptations - and how their lives mirror those of their human cousins. He begins by meeting an orang-utan that uses soap to improve its personal hygiene, baboons with a taste for flamingos, criminal-minded macaques and fluorescent mandrills that don warpaint before going into battle.(n)

programme.title: Great Barrier Reef
programme.desc: An exploration of Australia's underwater ecosystem, one of the natural wonders of the world and the largest living structure on the planet. In the first of three programmes, marine biologist Monty Halls examines the complex form of the coral reef itself and the wildlife that lives on it, from deadly fish-hunting snails and sharks that can walk on land to fighting corals and parrotfish, which cocoon themselves every night.(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.sub-title: Christina Trevanion v Mark Stacey Car Boot.
programme.desc: Mark Stacey and Christina Trevanion search for items at a West Sussex car boot sale with a budget of £250 each, with Mark battling broken bones to make a profit.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Royal Recipes
programme.desc: Michael Buerk celebrates food served to monarchs from George IV to the present day, beginning with dishes prepared for coronations. With Paul Ainsworth and Anna Haugh.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Actor Nigel Havers and his ex-agent Michael Whitehall embark on a treasure-hunting trip across the West Country. Travelling via Bentley and TVR, and with £400 each in hand, the pair's trip sees them meet some Bristol Savages, and take in a spot of Georgian elegance as they hear the story of `the King of Bath'. The duo are aided in their search by experts Margie Cooper and James Braxton, but will it be Nigel's old cockle bucket or Michael's tambourine that secures the biggest return at auction?.(n)

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: The fourth first-round match sees an Oxbridge clash as four students from St Edmund's College, Cambridge, pit their wits against a team from Magdalen College, Oxford, in a bid to reach the second stage. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions.(n)

programme.title: Nadiya's British Food Adventure
programme.desc: Nadiya Hussain takes a culinary road trip across Yorkshire, meeting fisherman Frank Powell near Bridlington and using some of his catch to cook baked sea trout with sun-dried tomatoes and lemons. She then heads to Huddersfield to sample local halloumi made by Syrian refugee Razan Alsous, creating watermelon and halloumi skewers. At home, Nadiya makes rhubarb and custard ice-cream sandwiches and Yorkshire puddings filled with strawberry jam and custard.(n)

programme.title: Dangerous Borders: A Journey Across India & Pakistan
programme.desc: New series. Seventy years after Partition, journalists Adnan Sarwar and Babita Sharma travel along the still-contentious border of Pakistan and India, finding out about the people who live there. They begin in the west in Adipur, which started out as a refugee camp for Hindus fleeing the newly created Muslim state of Pakistan, where Babita discovers a town that is an unlikely haven for Charlie Chaplin impersonators, while Adnan explores the cultural life of the metropolis of Karachi.(n)

programme.title: Normal for Norfolk
programme.desc: As the cafe closes for the winter months, Desmond MacCarthy must rely on other aspects of his business to bring in an income. Keen to attract overseas guests, he launches his holiday cottages on website Airbnb and lures an international interiors magazine to do a photo shoot and feature on his ancestral home. Toby Jones narrates.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Emma Barnett.(n)

programme.title: This World
programme.sub-title: North Korea: Murder in the Family.
programme.desc: Documentary examining the murder of the North Korean dictator's half-brother Kim Jong-nam at Kuala Lumpur airport. The programme examines the activities of North Korean secret agents at the airport on the day of the killing, and reports on a powerful international business network that has allowed the Kim dynasty to remain in power for nearly 70 years.(n)

programme.title: BBC Proms 2017
programme.desc: Petroc Trelawny introduces a concert of pieces by Rachmaninov, performed by the BBC Scottish Symphony Orchestra, conducted by Thomas Dausgaard and joined by the Latvian Radio Choir. The performance features the composers Second Symphony and Third Piano Concerto, with soloist Alexander Gavrylyuk.(n)

programme.title: John Denver at Wembley Arena
programme.desc: A classic performance by the US musician at London's Wembley Arena in 1979, originally shown as part of a selection of programmes to mark the 70th year since the birth of the quintessential `country boy'.(n)

programme.title: The Sky at Night
programme.desc: Chris Lintott and Maggie Aderin-Pocock keep an eye out for the Perseids meteor shower, and investigate the cosmic debris that falls to Earth from space.(n)

programme.title: Black Roses: The Killing of Sophie Lancaster
programme.desc: The story of the 20-year-old's death, told through poems written by Simon Armitage and an interview with her mother Sylvia. Sophie recalls her childhood, school life and the events leading up to her murder by a group of youths while she protected her boyfriend from a violent attack. Documentary drama, starring Rachel Austin.(n)

programme.title: Return to Betjemanland
programme.desc: Documentary focusing on the life and work of John Betjeman, the writer and broadcaster who was Poet Laureate from 1972 until his death in 1984. Betjeman's biographer, AN Wilson, visits places of significance to the poet, travelling through `Betjemanland' - which consists of areas in London, Oxford, Cornwall, Somerset and Berkshire. In doing so, the presenter paints a portrait of his subject's complexity, and reveals how he adopted a somewhat contradictory approach to social class and religion.(n)

programme.title: The Man Who Fought the Planners: The Story of Ian Nairn
programme.desc: Documentary charting the career of opinionated journalist and architectural critic Ian Nairn. In 1955, his attack on the soulless destruction of Britain by post-war planners was published in the Architectural Review and was influential in the formation of the Civic Trust. Over the next two decades, he became a passionate campaigner and inspired a whole generation to take up arms against the second-rate buildings in towns and cities. Includes tributes from colleagues and admirers including Jonathan Meades, Gillian Darley and Jonathan Glancey.(n)

programme.title: Storyville
programme.sub-title: Storyville: Russia's Toughest Prison - The Condemned.
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the hidden world of one of Russia's most impenetrable and remote institutions - a maximum-security prison reserved exclusively for murderers. The site holds 260 inmates that have collectively killed nearly 800 people, and uncensored interviews give an insight into the prisoners' minds and lives as they discuss topics such as their crimes, life and death, redemption, remorselessness, insanity and hope.(n)

programme.title: How Quizzing Got Cool: TV's Brains of Britain
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell, Judith Keppel, Chris Tarrant, Mark Labbett and Nicholas Parsons help Ben Miller trace the origins of the pro-quizzers; quiz show veterans who have emerged from the crowd of quiz aficionados in recent years to achieve fame and fortune for their general knowledge prowess.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: Eisteddfod 2017 with Josie d'Arby
programme.desc: Songs of Praise presenter Josie d'Arby gets back to her Welsh roots by exploring the appeal of the annual National Eisteddfod, one of Europe's oldest travelling cultural festivals. Set apart from Britain's other summer festivals, the National Eisteddfod remains a uniquely Welsh exhibition of druidic pageantry, poetry, music and visual art, and Josie sets out to determine what drives thousands of attendees to return to witness the nine-day cultural contest each year.(n)

programme.title: The Town That Thread Built
programme.desc: Actress and one-time 'mill-girl' Phyllis Logan narrates this documentary charting the social history of Scotland's biggest town, Paisley, including remarkable archive material drawn from the Paisley mills and others across the world.(n)

programme.title: Vikings
programme.desc: Neil Oliver continues his attempt to shed new light on the Norse warriors by examining their sophisticated trading skills, and visits locations in Russia, Turkey and Ireland to explain how they established a business empire. He also explores the vast array of goods that were bought and sold by Viking merchants and settlers, including Chinese silks and Pictish slaves.(n)

programme.title: Storyville
programme.sub-title: Storyville: Out of Thin Air - Murder in Iceland.
programme.desc: Documentary looking at the reopening of a 1974 murder case, when new evidence lead to the exposure one of the most shocking miscarriages of justice Europe has ever witnessed.(n)

programme.title: Sex and Sensibility: The Allure of Art Nouveau
programme.desc: Stephen Smith explores how the development of the `jugendstil' aesthetic revolutionised the art and architecture of Vienna in the late 19th and early 20th centuries. Through the work of artists and designers including Gustav Klimt, Josef Hoffmann, Koloman Moser and Egon Schiele, he explains how Viennese disciples of art nouveau rebelled against establishment ideas and sought to make their art socially relevant. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: NCIS

Also: an idea for teaching kids how to ride a bike; a hamburger truck that's painted hot pink and staffed by beautiful women; a photo-booth business; and an update on a spatula that failed to interest the Sharks(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 723. Two Denver high-school freshmen think they have a tasty way to improve the ice cream cone; an entrepreneur from Bend, Ore., puts an athletic twist on a kid stroller; an Austin woman contends her kids' line is intended to make the lives of parents easier; and a magician duo from Las Vegas perform for the Sharks. Also: an update on Mark Cuban's Season 6 investment in Gameday Couture(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 603. Two men try to sell the Sharks on their stuffed animals for the bathtub; a dog lover from Los Angeles shows off a wearable pet carrier; and ninja entrepreneurs demonstrate a darts-like card game. Also: a follow-up on a custom bike company based in Dallas, which was invested in by Mark and Barbara during Season 3(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 624. Collectible products for celebrity superfans are pitched to the Sharks, who also hear an idea for a mobile app that allows users to reserve a barstool. Also: a men's clothing line that's all made in America; a high-tech insole created by a former NFL player; and an update on Barbara's investment in Pork Barrel BBQ from Season 1(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 511. An Austin couple shock the Sharks with the profits they are making from knee-high boot socks; publicists from Santa Monica, Cal., have come up with a stylish clutch that's perfect for carrying smartphones; and a finance expert pitches his idea for customized chocolate bars. Also: a way for kids to personalize their lunch boxes; and an update on a device that prevents objects from falling out of reach between a car's seat and the center console(n)

There is also a cricket-mad grandad building a mini pavilion in his garden, with the 1950s-inspired build incorporating bats, bails and even a boundary rope alongside an ingenious bunk bed that with the pull of a chord transforms into a sofa. George's German road trip reaches Berlin, and a house situated where the Wall once stood.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons

Disaster thriller, starring Tommy Lee Jones, Anne Heche, Gaby Hoffmann, Keith David and Don Cheadle. Edited for language and violence.(n)

He discovers that the magical artefact that brings them to life is damaged, so he and his friends travel to London's Natural History Museum to find a way to restore it. With the aid of an unhinged former patient, he turns a disused bunker underneath an underground station into his own illegal clinic where he can treat his comatose wife himself. However, his search for an elusive cure requires money, so he resorts to treating people who cannot seek medical help through official channels, from refugees to criminal gangs. In Norwegian. Full series available online.(n)

programme.desc: In Sheffield, the property developer meets Russ and Jen Hunt, who are desperate to have a larger family, but their new-build is already bursting at the seams with just one child. Unable to afford the move to a bigger home, the couple are embarking on their first-ever extension. However, the whole project is under threat before the foundations can even be laid. In the Hertfordshire village of Radlett, Sarah meets Adam and Laura Margolis, who sold their four-bedroom house and bought a bungalow after Adam, who has multiple sclerosis, found climbing the stairs impossible. They now face the challenge of adapting the property to make it more accessible, while creating a stylish home to enjoy with their two children.(n)

Leading the charge is Duncan McCallum, a veteran customs officer who has tackled drug rings, smugglers and massive duty fraud, while new teams are also targeting offshore accounts that could secure the Government millions in unpaid tax.(n)

Elsewhere, Stewart and Victor chase £1,000 from a debtor who has defaulted on his payment plan, but they are subjected to abuse and the police are called to a driveway standoff. Plus, two agents try to recover £1,600 worth of goods from the owner of an entertainment company after a wedding day dispute, and in west London, a landlady is owned £9,000 in rent arrears by a young mother.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
