Puppet adventure based on Gerry Anderson's TV series, featuring the voices of Shane Rimmer, Ray Barrett, Alexander Davion, Peter Dyneley, Sylvia Anderson and Cliff Richard, voicing a puppet version of himself.(n)

programme.title: Patti Cake$ Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Geremy Jasper and stars Danielle Macdonald, Cathy Moriarty, Bridget Everett and Siddharth Dhananjay talk about making the comedy.(n)

programme.title: Picture Perfect
programme.desc: An ambitious executive hires a man to pose as her fiance to give her a stable image at work and attract a colleague who is only tempted by unavailable women. However, her fantasy life soon spirals out of control, leaving her unable to tell the difference between fact and fiction. Romantic comedy, with Jennifer Aniston, Jay Mohr, Kevin Bacon, Olympia Dukakis and Illeana Douglas.(n)

programme.title: Dragonball Evolution
programme.desc: An ordinary teenager is recruited by a mystical martial arts master for a vitally important quest. He must find seven magical spheres before they fall into the hands of an evil warlord, who intends to use their power to let him take over the world. Fantasy adventure based on the Japanese cartoon series, starring Justin Chatwin, Chow Yun-Fat and James Marsters.(n)

programme.title: Shrek
programme.desc: Anti-social ogre Shrek resolves to stop an evil ruler from banishing fairy-tale characters to his swampland home. However, the reluctant hero ends up forced to rescue the beautiful Princess Fiona from a castle guarded by a dragon, aided only by a wisecracking donkey. Animated comedy, with the voices of Mike Myers, John Lithgow, Cameron Diaz, Eddie Murphy and Vincent Cassel.(n)

programme.title: The Way Back
programme.desc: Siberian gulag prisoners stage a daring escape during the Second World War. Refusing to live under Stalin's rule, they embark on a gruelling 4,500-mile journey across inhospitable terrain to escape the Soviet Union. Peter Weir's drama, starring Ed Harris, Colin Farrell, Saoirse Ronan, Jim Sturgess and Mark Strong.(n)

programme.title: The Heat
programme.desc: An uptight, ambitious FBI agent is sent to Boston to bring a notorious drug kingpin to justice. She ends up forced to team up with a rebellious, foul-mouthed local police detective who has a very different attitude to law enforcement but shares her inability to work with others. Action comedy, starring Sandra Bullock and Melissa McCarthy.(n)

programme.title: Vertigo
programme.desc: A private eye with an aversion to heights is hired to trail the wife of an old college friend because of her strange and inconsistent behaviour. However, he soon falls obsessively in love with her, and is drawn into a complex and destructive mystery. Alfred Hitchcock's thriller, starring Kim Novak in a dual role alongside James Stewart, Barbara Bel Geddes and Tom Helmore.(n)

programme.title: Hitchcock/Truffaut
programme.desc: Documentary exploring Alfred Hitchcock's work and influence and the effect Francois Truffaut's 1967 book about the English film director had on his standing in the film world. Hitchcock's work is also considered from a wider perspective and there are interviews with film-makers inspired by both men, including Martin Scorsese, David Fincher, Wes Anderson, Olivier Assayas, Peter Bogdanovich and Richard Linklater.(n)

programme.title: One Fine Day
programme.desc: The working day for two mismatched single professionals is thrown into turmoil when their children have to stay at home after missing a school trip. The pair agree to take it in turns to babysit while struggling to stick to their hectic schedules - but during the course of the day their feelings for each other blossom unexpectedly. Romantic comedy, starring George Clooney, Michelle Pfeiffer, Charles Durning and Mae Whitman.(n)

programme.title: Sunshine on Leith
programme.desc: Two soldiers return home to the Scottish port town after finishing their tour of duty in Afghanistan. While they struggle to adjust to life as civilians, the parents of one of the squaddies prepare to celebrate their 30th anniversary in style. Musical featuring songs by the Proclaimers, starring George MacKay, Kevin Guthrie, Peter Mullan and Jane Horrocks.(n)

programme.title: Antz
programme.desc: A neurotic worker ant passes himself off as a soldier to impress a princess. However, he provokes a jealously ambitious general with an accidental act of heroism - so he and his beloved decide to flee the brutal colony and go in search of the promised land of Insectopia. Animated comedy, with the voices of Woody Allen, Sharon Stone, Gene Hackman and Sylvester Stallone.(n)

programme.title: Big Business
programme.desc: The first-born babies in two sets of identical twins are mixed up at birth by a short-sighted nurse, leading to their being raised in very different social circles. In later life, one pair, brought up in a poor mining town, visits New York to challenge a powerful conglomerate - only to find their respective siblings are in charge of the company. Comedy, starring Bette Midler and Lily Tomlin in dual roles alongside Fred Ward and Edward Herrmann.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of Walter Mitty
programme.desc: An ordinary man seeks solace from his mundane life by drifting into daydreams where he is a heroic figure. When he and a friend are faced with unemployment, he is propelled into a globetrotting adventure in real life. Comedy drama based on James Thurber's short story, directed by and starring Ben Stiller. With Kristen Wiig, Adam Scott and Shirley MacLaine.(n)

programme.title: All Is Lost
programme.desc: A man travelling alone across the Indian Ocean suffers a collision with a shipping container that leaves his vessel badly damaged. With few supplies and the navigation and radio equipment destroyed, he is forced to use old-fashioned methods to get to safety - but his journey brings him into the path of a tempest. Thriller, starring Robert Redford.(n)

programme.title: Bad Teacher
programme.desc: Cynical, hard-drinking teacher Elizabeth Halsey hates her job and the kids in her class, and hopes to escape her daily grind by landing a rich husband. A wealthy substitute seems like a suitable candidate, but she has a rival for his attention in a squeaky-clean colleague. Comedy, starring Cameron Diaz, Justin Timberlake, Jason Segel and Lucy Punch.(n)

programme.title: En busca de la ciudad perdida
Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten throws a surprise baby shower, with Greek gazpacho, baked salmon nicoise and pecan shortbread on the menu.(n)

programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten cooks striped bass and couscous with pine nuts for a group of food-lovers.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten throws a holiday dinner party for friends, featuring halibut, shrimp in a saffron sauce and a seafood gratin of lobster.(n)

programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten welcomes her husband back from a trip away with lemon curd tart and mussels in white wine.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman

programme.desc: Ree makes a meal using a whole bottle of tequila.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares recipes using leeks, including pappardelle and a `concertina' squid dish. He also explains why the underrated vegetables can be a real asset in the kitchen and offers advice on how to grow and store them.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef serves simple recipes using winter vegetables grown in his Essex garden. He prepares a seasonal coleslaw and bubble and squeak, and uses homegrown cabbage to make an Italian soup.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver turns his attention to recipes using furred game, including rabbit - once a staple on Britain's dinner tables - fed on the best vegetables from the chef's garden. He demonstrates how to prepare his own Essex fried rabbit, along with free-range venison and a pearl barley ragu.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates the versatility of pastry as he prepares a variety of sweet and savoury recipes using pastry along with home-grown fruit and vegetables from his Essex garden. The chef shows how to create an Italian ham, nettle and spinach tart, a pie made with steak, Guinness and cheese, plus a traditional apple and blackberry pie.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver turns his attention to dishes using eggs collected from his hand-reared free-range hens. He creates a home-made tagliatelle, an omelette salad with bresaola, and a meringue with hot pears and chocolate sauce. He also starts some former battery hens off on their journey to a free-range life.(n)

programme.title: Jamie and Jimmy's Friday Night Feast
programme.desc: Actress and Britain's Got Talent judge Amanda Holden demonstrates her culinary skills by rustling up a moussaka in the kitchen, Jamie Oliver prepares two-way chicken for the weekend and Jimmy Doherty tries his hand at DIY kebabs. The duo also breathe life into another lost sweet classic - maid of honour tarts - which date back to the days of Henry VIII.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri heads to Cincinnati to visit three restaurants on one street. First up is the pub where a husband and wife duo dish out all kinds of creative hot dogs and sandwiches.(n)

programme.desc: Guy Fieri gets nostalgic on a trip to Duluth, where an Italian market and restaurant is serving up hearty home-made lasagne and a monster muffaletta.(n)

programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a Baltimore restaurant that is serving up chicken wings alongside a steak wrap.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri sets out searching for a selection of seafood dishes, and stops by a barbecue joint in Des Moines serving up smoked chicken wings.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits an historic Des Moines, Iowa, drive-in famous for its chilli recipe, which is almost 100 years old.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy checks out a funky fusion joint serving up unique burritos. In Beaverdale, a southern spot's cooking up all the classics. In Atlantic City, a husband/wife duo dishes out soul food standouts.(n)

programme.title: Bakers vs. Fakers
programme.desc: New series. Pro and amateur bakers face off during a fruit tart battle, combining a variety of mustards with their sweet treats.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The owner of a German restaurant in Glendale, Arizona, fears his new manager, who happens to be his wife's nephew, is unqualified for the job.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: After losing thousands of dollars in unaccounted alcohol, the owner of Big Earl's Greasy Eats in Cave Creek investigates rumours of unauthorised late-night staff parties.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Willie Degel helps the owner of Athena Mediterranean Cuisine in Brooklyn where its dwindling customer base is beginning to suggest that business and family are a bad mix.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits food hot spots in Havana, including a place cooking house-cured lamb, and a house-turned-restaurant dishing out savoury goat stew.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a place cooking lamb in indoor smokers, an Italian deli making ravioli on a century-old machine, and a pizza oven in Hawaii creating island twists on meaty pies.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fierier visits a New Jersey diner where the chefs produce 30 different varieties of pancakes from scratch.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fierier heads to an authentic Mexican restaurant in Phoenix, and pulls over at a Kentucky truck stop, where homemade biscuits are served with everything.(n)

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.desc: Ina Garten provides a modern twist to classic recipes, including meatloaf and smoked salmon devilled eggs.(n)

programme.desc: Chef Ina Garten prepares a roasted butternut squash salad.(n)

programme.desc: Ina Garten prepares lemon chicken breasts and a recipe from one of her favourite New York restaurants.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: Recipes for desserts, including fruit filled cranberry and apple cake. There is also a masterclass from patisserie chef Claudia Fleming, who prepares lemon cream napoleon.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Fresh
programme.desc: The chef plans a picnic menu for some friends to enjoy at a local music event, and stops by a honey apiary.(n)

programme.desc: The chef prepares sticky blueberry buns for a relaxing brunch with her nephew.(n)

programme.title: The Healthy Gourmet

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond demonstrates how to prepare a super-fast meal from a selection of store cupboard ingredients.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: The Drummond's play a game of football, and Ree prepares a dinner of beef and bean burritos, with a jumbo pico salad for after their match.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: It's a big working day on the Drummond Ranch and that means hungry kids and cowboys at lunch time. Ree will be whipping up a hearty feast of cowboy comfort food.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Three generations of Drummonds are gathering at the lodge for Sunday brunch after church. Ree's planned a spectacular menu featuring a glorious baked glazed ham.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Cake Wars
programme.desc: Contestants create cakes based around the DC Comics franchise, featuring characters such as Batman, Aquaman and Spiderman.(n)

programme.title: Beach Bites With Katie Lee
programme.desc: Between a Florida-created Reuben sandwich, to an ice cream sandwich pressed like a panini in Georgia, chefs teach Katie how to bring some local flair to fan-favourite dishes.(n)

programme.title: Beach Bites With Katie Lee
programme.desc: This time, Katie Lee is exploring the beaches of Mexico, St Barts and other coastal canteens.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver focuses on dishes containing onions, garlic and leeks, using them to produce simple meals including a salad, soup, and roast pork with an onion and potato al forno. He also chats to a gardener about the health benefits of raw garlic.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver uses a variety of carrots in an Indian salad, demonstrates how they can be used to complement a pork chop and discovers why the vegetable is orange. He then prepares foil-roasted smoked beetroot with beef and a cottage cheese dressing.(n)

programme.title: Jamie Does
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver visits the villages surrounding Toulouse in the French Pyrenees, an area renowned for its artisan food. He goes truffle-hunting and prepares an omelette with the pickings, learns how to make bread in the traditional way, and joins locals for a wild boar hunt. The chef also shows how to prepare tarte Tatin, Roquefort salad, confit of duck and a country-style terrine.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond's bakes a caramel apple pie and a frozen grasshopper pie, as well as strawberry pretzel pie and mini blueberry galettes.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond makes homemade takeout for lunch, with Tex-Mex fried rice and salad. For dinner, she prepares smothered pork chops with smashed red potatoes and sliced tomatoes.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Cake Wars
programme.desc: Contestants create cakes for a wedding, with theknot.com providing everything for a couples dream wedding, except the cake.(n)

programme.title: Kids BBQ Championship
programme.desc: Hosts Camila Alves and Eddie Jackson meet eight fierce kid barbecue cooks, and the competition kicks off with each cooking famous flavours atop chicken and a signature side.(n)

programme.title: Jamie Does
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver visits the Greek capital, where he heads to the street markets for his take on the local fast food - souvlaki and kebabs. The chef then learns how honey is made, teams up with a cheese-making priest and milks a goat, and prepares a selection of recipes including fisherman's stew, Greek salad, pistachio and honey cake, and a tuna dish.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver rustles up simple, seasonal dishes and demonstrates how to cook using home-grown potatoes. Among the dishes on the menu are Spanish omelette and a roast chicken tray bake with tomatoes. Outside in the garden, Brian shows how tasty spuds can be cultivated in the smallest of spaces.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver cooks using peppers and chillies. The menu includes a spicy pork goulash and an experimental dish of smoked salmon with a zingy salsa. He also joins Brian for a taste-test of the hottest chilli in the world - and it is the loyal gardener who keeps his cool.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: Roger Mooking visits South Carolina for two spectacular low country cookouts, a traditional backyard 'pig pickin', and a classic oyster roast.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: Roger Mooking loads up on the best brisket, pork steaks and sausages the Lone Star state has to offer.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's American Road Trip
programme.desc: Having sampled some of America's most diverse dietary offerings, Jamie Oliver sets out in search of the country's cheapest culinary treats. In Georgia, he meets family members who have been growing, killing and cooking their own food for generations, and asks them to lend him their expertise at a barbecue contest in Florida. He also encounters the cake-baking Sex and Savannah women, and visits a soul food restaurant struggling to survive in harsh financial times.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Willie Degel is called in to Sonrisa Grill to help the once lively Mexican restaurant. The owner, Chanthy, has borrowed from relatives to keep the suffering grill alive.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: Fearing their award-winning burger recipe is being given away, the owners of the Latin House, Miami contact Charles, who tries find out if there are any moles in their warehouse.(n)

programme.title: Waiting for God
programme.desc: Harvey invites local students into Bayview to interact with the residents, and bribes one to deliberately annoy troublemaking resident Diana in the hope she will retaliate and be thrown out of the home.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Has Anyone Seen Barry's Midlife Crisis?.
programme.desc: Truly's plans to rescue Howard from his bedroom are given a boost when Auntie Wainwright puts some lightweight scaffolding up for sale - ideal for springing someone imprisoned on an upper floor. Long-running comedy series, starring Frank Thornton and Robert Fyfe.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Genuine Outdoors Robin Hood Barbi.
programme.desc: Billy promises the gang a perfect barbecue in the great outdoors - without a newfangled portable contraption - and takes Clegg, Truly, Alvin and Entwistle into the Dales. He knows the ideal spot - if he can just remember how to find it. Long-running comedy, starring Keith Clifford and Peter Sallis.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Barry in Danger from Reading and Aunt Jessie.
programme.desc: Nora Batty spots Alvin with a mystery woman, and convinces herself that the couple are becoming close after some devious work by the elderly Lothario and a blushing Billy. Pearl spots a lonely hearts advertisement that she is sure is from Howard. Kathy Staff, Brian Murphy and Keith Clifford star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Who's That Merry Man with Billy, Then?.
programme.desc: After recruitment for his Merry Men hits an all-time low, a letter from an enthusiast with excellent credentials gets Billy excited again, and he organises a committee to greet the newest member. Long-running comedy, starring Keith Clifford and Peter Sallis.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The day of the wedding arrives and Bryn is still behaving oddly around Stacey's brother. Nessa debates whether to share her big secret and Smithy resolves to give a superb best man's speech - but finds himself overcome with emotion under the spotlight. Mathew Horne and Joanna Page star.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Smithy goes missing following Nessa's shocking revelation, and the boys try to track him down to persuade him to accept his responsibilities. Meanwhile, Stacey is forced to contemplate the consequences of transforming her long-distance relationship with Gavin into a functioning marriage.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: After a day spent house-hunting, the newlyweds take up an invitation from Nessa and Smithy to relax with a trip to the bowling alley. However, when tensions between Gavin and Stacey reach a head at the end of the night, their two friends begin to regret making the offer.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Hapless uncle Bryn organises a special treat for Gwen's birthday. However, his supposedly covert actions do not go as unnoticed as he would like, and an unexpected guest arrives. Meanwhile, Stacey tries to summon the courage to tell Gavin of her big decision.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The newlyweds begin leading separate lives back in their home towns. In Essex, Smithy makes efforts to remind Gavin of the excitement of his bachelor years with a traditional boys' night out. Meanwhile in Barry, Stacey tries to distract herself with a trip to the bingo.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Nessa goes into labour a month early in Barry, and the newlyweds must forget their differences to track down Smithy in time for the birth of his child. Meanwhile, Stacey returns to Essex to salvage her marriage.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.sub-title: Gavin & Stacey Christmas Special: The Christmas Announcement.
programme.desc: On Christmas Eve, the Wests join the Shipmans for one of Mick's famous turkey dinners. Smithy can hardly wait to spend his first yuletide with baby Neil, but fails to realise Dave will be tagging along and playing happy families with Nessa. Meanwhile, Gavin and Stacey make an announcement that does not exactly fill their friends and relatives with joy, and Bryn has a heart-to-heart with Jason. Festive edition of the comedy from 2008, starring Mathew Horne and Joanna Page.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Gavin starts his job in Cardiff and, while Stacey is thrilled to be back in Wales, Smithy has to come to terms with living in Essex without his best friend. Nessa has taken up residence in Dave's caravan in Sully and is getting ready for Neil's christening. The event means a big reunion for the gang, at which Smithy receives surprising news from Nessa, and Stacey has a special request for her husband.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Dave is unhappy about Nessa's plans to let Smithy see the baby, while Stacey ensures Gavin sticks to his promise as she tries to find a new job. Meanwhile, Dawn and Pete join Pam and Mick for a beer and curry night. Comedy, starring Joanna Page and Mathew Horne.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Dave is unhappy about Nessa's plans to let Smithy see the baby, while Stacey ensures Gavin sticks to his promise as she tries to find a new job. Meanwhile, Dawn and Pete join Pam and Mick for a beer and curry night. Comedy, starring Joanna Page and Mathew Horne.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Bryn is in his element as he awaits the arrival of the Essex boys, who are having a big night out in Cardiff and staying for a sleepover, but Smithy is concerned about seeing Nessa again after their last meeting. Meanwhile, Stacey tells Gavin about a worrying discovery, and Pam and Mick discuss their plans for a new conservatory.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Everyone gathers in Billericay as Pete and Dawn prepare to renew their wedding vows. Gavin feels uncomfortable about Gwen and Bryn knowing the details of his sex life, and Dave hears about the shocking events of the curry night. Meanwhile, Smithy goes beyond the call of friendship when he makes a staggering suggestion.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Bank Holiday Monday sees the Essex contingent arrive for a sunny day at the beach in Barry. Gavin has a heart-to-heart with his dad, which gives him much to think about, while a dark cloud looms on the horizon when Dave arrives to find Nessa and Smithy enjoying all the fun of the fair. Mathew Horne, Joanna Page, James Corden and Ruth Jones star.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Preparations for Nessa and Dave's wedding are in full swing, Stacey has life-changing news for Gavin, and Bryn and Jason put their big secret to bed once and for all. Finally, the wedding arrives and, as Nessa prepares to make her way to the church, Smithy takes the opportunity to have one last chat. Mathew Horne, Joanna Page, James Corden, Ruth Jones and Rob Brydon star.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.sub-title: Gavin & Stacey Christmas Special: The Christmas Announcement.
programme.desc: On Christmas Eve, the Wests join the Shipmans for one of Mick's famous turkey dinners. Smithy can hardly wait to spend his first yuletide with baby Neil, but fails to realise Dave will be tagging along and playing happy families with Nessa. Meanwhile, Gavin and Stacey make an announcement that does not exactly fill their friends and relatives with joy, and Bryn has a heart-to-heart with Jason. Festive edition of the comedy from 2008, starring Mathew Horne and Joanna Page.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: It seems that everyone in the Brown family has a date for Valentine's Day except Agnes, so she turns to the internet to find herself a man. Dermot tries to come up with a loving gesture to prove to Maria he can still be romantic - but he makes the mistake of taking advice from Buster - while Agnes and Winnie are fascinated by Betty's sex manual and Grandad ends up addicted to Viagra. Hit comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll.(n)

programme.title: Men Behaving Badly
programme.desc: Tony develops a sudden interest in astrology when Deborah announces her fascination with the mystical art. Meanwhile, Gary disapproves of the new pub landlord's policies about lock-ins and bar tabs. Neil Morrissey, Leslie Ash and Martin Clunes star.(n)

programme.title: Men Behaving Badly
programme.desc: A road-rage incident leaves Gary looking a coward - so he decides to save his reputation with a scheme that naturally smacks of disaster. Meanwhile, Tony's sordid imagination begins to work overtime as Deborah's close friend Judy visits. Laddish comedy, starring Martin Clunes and Neil Morrissey.(n)

programme.title: The Trip
programme.desc: Steve and Rob visit Hipping Hall near Kirkby Lonsdale in Cumbria as they continue their culinary tour of the north of England, and are joined for a meal by Steve's agent Emma and Spanish photographer Yolanda. Comedy, starring Steve Coogan and Rob Brydon.(n)

programme.title: The Trip
programme.desc: Steve and Rob visit the world-famous Malham limestone pavement and eat at the Yorke Arms, as they continue their culinary tour of the north of England, reviewing restaurants for a Sunday newspaper. Comedy, starring Steve Coogan and Rob Brydon.(n)

programme.title: Big Train
programme.desc: More comedy sketches from the award-winning team as a boxing toddler is forced by her parents to throw a fight, beefeaters riot on the streets of Britain, a campaign to ban the tiger is initiated, and the cockney gangster movie Alright Mate? receives its UK premiere. Starring Simon Pegg and Kevin Eldon.(n)

programme.title: Big Train
programme.desc: More comic sketches from the award-winning team, including a babysitter who gets a surprise when she looks after Dame Margot Fontaine and a reassessment of US involvement in the Vietnam War. Simon Pegg, Mark Heap, Tracy-Ann Oberman, Rebecca Front and Kevin Eldon star.(n)

programme.title: Men Behaving Badly
programme.desc: Tony develops a sudden interest in astrology when Deborah announces her fascination with the mystical art. Meanwhile, Gary disapproves of the new pub landlord's policies about lock-ins and bar tabs. Neil Morrissey, Leslie Ash and Martin Clunes star.(n)

programme.title: Waiting for God
programme.desc: Tom's son Geoffrey summons the courage to walk out on his wife, and moves into Bayview instead - but after a few days of his boring company Diana hatches a plan to get rid of him.(n)

programme.title: To the Manor Born
programme.desc: Audrey reprimands DeVere for not fulfilling his duties as lord of the manor when he fails to attend church on Sunday, but then forgets to practise what she preaches. Penelope Keith and Peter Bowles star.(n)

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: Gordon urges his staff to play the complicated board game he has designed for his Plan for the Future fortnight, while Helen spends £300 on a performing dog, whose outrageous tricks include removing ladies' underwear. Chris Barrie stars.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Has Anyone Seen a Peruvian Wart?.
programme.desc: Roy Barraclough guest stars as Crowcroft, a well-known Lothario with a preference for gullible women. When he samples Nora Batty's baking, he decides to make her his next target. Long-running comedy, with Kathy Staff, Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg's decision to write his memoirs causes Howard a great deal of concern, while Smiler is devastated when a blossoming relationship ends suddenly. Long-running comedy series, starring Peter Sallis, Robert Fyfe and Stephen Lewis.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Who's That Mouse in the Poetry Group?.
programme.desc: Smiler begins attending a poetry group and is inspired to write verses for an enchanted Marina. When the two go to the meeting together, an anxious Howard needs to find a way of keeping an eye on them without being seen - and Truly claims to have the perfect solution.(n)

programme.title: Porridge

programme.title: The Supersizers Eat
programme.desc: Giles Coren and Sue Perkins travel back to 44BC for a culinary journey through the early days of ancient Rome. Chef Valentina Harris prepares a range of exotic dishes, including a sauce made from rotten fish innards, and the duo discover the origins of pasta and pizza when they visit the Colosseum. After an attempt to conquer Britain, where they sample oysters, the pair return to Rome to enjoy a final banquet with Kenneth Cranham, Adrian Goldsworthy and Angela Pagano.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: From 2011, 12 enthusiastic home-cooks take part in a culinary contest devised by Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry to determine which of them is Britain's best amateur baker. In the first round, the competitors are challenged to make 24 decorated cupcakes in two hours, before being asked to bake a coffee and walnut Battenberg cake. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The 11 remaining bakers are given the task of creating a quiche that reflects their personalities, before tackling the technical challenge - tarte au citron. The pressure proves too much for some, as they try to impress judges Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The remaining contestants test their bread-making skills as they embark on a series of challenges. After cooking a flavoured loaf, they face the task of baking focaccia. A display basket featuring 24 rolls forms the final leg of the challenge, before judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood reveal who will leave the competition. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The remaining bakers test their biscuit-making skills as they embark on a series of challenges. After cooking their own interpretation of a classic, the contestants face the task of baking brandy snaps. Preparing a display of macaroons forms the final leg of the challenge, before the judges reveal who will leave the competition. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The remaining bakers test their pie-making skills as they embark on a series of challenges. After serving up their signature dish for judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood, they are faced with cooking six individual pork pies - a task that proves problematic for vegetarian Jason - and preparing a meringue. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The remaining bakers test their dessert-making skills as they embark on a series of challenges. After serving up cheesecake and chocolate roulade for judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood, this quarter-final showstopper sees the cooks creating a croquembouche - a choux pastry tower made of hundreds of profiteroles. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Remaining contestants Holly, Janet, Jo and Mary-Anne test their pastry-making skills in the next set of challenges. After serving mousse cake and iced fingers to judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood, the cooks create a dough capable of being used in three types of pastry or croissant. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The remaining three hopefuls compete in the 2011 final, which sees them cooking for a street party attended by judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood, as well as friends, family and former Bake Off contestants. Their offerings include mille-feuille, mini Victoria sponges, and miniature strawberry and rhubarb cheesecakes. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.sub-title: The Great British Bake Off Masterclass.
programme.desc: In their fourth and concluding tutorial, Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood reveal what they would have made for the challenges in the final few weeks of the competition. Paul makes a wheat-free crusty rye loaf and sweet and savoury pretzels, while Mary prepares Sussex pond suet pudding and choux pastry religieuses and creates her own twist on the classic opera cake.(n)

programme.title: Floyd on France
programme.desc: The chef travels to the coastal town of Concarneau in Brittany, France, where he cooks chicken roasted with cider and served with stuffed artichokes, plus a Breton apple flan.(n)

programme.title: Floyd on France
programme.desc: Globetrotting chef Keith Floyd retraces his tour of France, taking another look at some of the ingredients he found in each region, including Provence, Perigord, Burgundy and Alsace.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall celebrates the best food that summer has to offer, rustling up dishes using the finest available seasonal produce. In the first episode, he visits a local farm that produces welfare-friendly animals, exploring the reasons why members of the British public often feel uneasy about eating veal. He also visits Manchester to extol the success of land-linking website Landshare.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: In the last programme of knockout week, the second group of five chefs face two tough tests. First they work together to cook a three-course fine dining lunch for ex-England captain Mike Gatting and his guests at Lord's cricket ground. They have to build their menu around mackerel, rabbit, apples and pears - and teamwork will be key as they to plan, execute and transport their dishes to the table. They then return to the MasterChef kitchen to produce a showstopper dish in just 90 minutes - hoping it will be enough to book their place in the semi-finals. As ever, deciding their fates will be no-nonsense judges Marcus Wareing and Monica Galetti.(n)

programme.title: Junior Bake Off
programme.desc: The young cooks battle for a place in the semi-finals, demonstrating their technical skills by following a chocolate brownie recipe. They also prepare Halloween-themed biscuits. Presented by Aaron Craze, with judges Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry.(n)

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Tom Kerridge is joined by fellow chef Richard Corrigan for a discussion on the unsung and neglected produce in the British larder. The Irishman champions the cause of offal, but has his work cut out persuading Tom that kidneys are ever worth the effort, while the host tries to revive the profile of hake by cooking the fish in a button mushroom sauce. Plus, resident drinks expert Joe Wadsack brings a German red wine to the table and Fast Show star Arabella Weir gets the inside track on why a good kitchen knife should last a lifetime.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Great Britain
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver arrives in the West Country, and decides to look beyond the usual fare of pasties, Cheddar and cider to find alternative dishes. In Bristol, he visits a traditional Jamaican chef, and joins radio DJ Jules Davis to sample her mother's Guyanese specialities. He also goes foraging for mushrooms, prepares an apple pepperpot pudding using Caribbean spices, and cooks a centuries-old recipe for Bath chaps - otherwise known as pigs' cheeks.(n)

programme.title: Heston's Gourmet Escape
programme.desc: Heston Blumenthal travels to Western Australia, looking for high-quality ingredients and enjoying the acclaimed Margaret River Gourmet Escape food and wine festival.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's 30 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares a quick meal of steak Indian-style, with spinach and paneer salad, naan bread and mango dessert.(n)

programme.desc: Nigella Lawson rustles up a selection of TV dinners for those occasions when time is of the essence, including Thai yellow pumpkin and seafood curry, linguine with garlic oil and pancetta, and salt and pepper squid.(n)

programme.title: Two Fat Ladies
programme.desc: Corpulent cooks Clarissa Dickson Wright and Jennifer Paterson pack their utensils in their rucksacks and set off to Kielder Forest where they feed a troop of hungry scouts. programme.title: Solaris
programme.desc: Steven Soderbergh's remake of the classic Andrei Torkovsky film stars George Clooney as the therapist sent to mentor a group of astronauts on the Prometheus space station, where the remaining crew are both locked in their own fears, speaking of visions of lost loved ones. At first sceptical, when Clooney's lost wife appears to him, he begins to wonder what influence the mysterious planet Solaris has on the human psyche(n)

programme.title: Aliens in the Attic
programme.desc: A group of kids defend their Maine vacation home from knee-high alien invaders in this rousing adventure comedy for the whole family. Shortly after Bethany Pearson (Ashley Tisdale) and her family arrive at their summer home, four aliens show up and enslave her boyfriend Ricky via a powerful mind-control device. While the adults are completely oblivious to the extraterrestrial threat, the kids fight to save the planet with a little help from Sparks, the one friendly alien(n)

programme.title: The Cider House Rules
programme.desc: John Irving's adaptation of his own novel won him an Oscar for Lasse Hallstrom's drama starring Tobey Maguire and Michael Caine (who also picked up a statue). Maguire is an orphan, mentored by Caine who runs the orphanage he grew up in but Maguire balks at Caine's side-line in illegal abortions. And after young couple Candy and Wally come to Larch for a termination, Homer returns home with them. After Wally is posted overseas on war duty, Homer and Candy become closer at the cider house where they work; but news of a fellow worker's pregnancy leads Homer to re-examine his principles(n)

programme.title: The English Patient
programme.desc: During the end of World War II a badly burned man lies in an abandoned Italian monastery, watched over by a French Canadian nurse. Nobody knows who he is or how he received his injuries. Then, the 'English patient' tells his tragic story of a passionate affair with a married woman, and of a betrayal(n)

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel
programme.desc: Segments include an interview with Chechen leader and MMA figure Ramzan Kadyrov; a look at global warming's effect on the Great Barrier Reef; a visit with MLB Hall of Famer Rod Carew, who underwent a heart and kidney transplant last December(n)

programme.title: Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping
programme.desc: A hugely popular rapper faces a career meltdown when his latest album tanks and his attempts to rehab his image only end in disaster. In time, he considers reuniting with his old rap trio, the Style Boyz(n)

programme.title: Selena
programme.desc: Selena was a 23-year old Tejana singer on the verge of an international breakthrough when she was shot by the president of her own fan club. Her death spawned an outpouring of grief not seen since the death of Elvis Presley. This upbeat and tuneful biopic, executive produced by her father, Abraham Quintanilla (portrayed in the film by Edward James Olmos), is a celebration of his daughter's life, chronicling her rise to fame. The film opens with Selena (Jennifer Lopez) performing at the Houston Astrodome before a sold-out audience. The story moves backwards and begins not with Selena, but with Abraham who in the early '60s had an unsuccessful doo-wop group in Texas. As a child, Selena (Rebecca Lee Meza) showed an exceptional talent for singing. Abraham exploited that and the talents of his other two children to form a band. Much of the film focuses on the fact that Selena, though born in Texas in a Mexican-American community, had to learn Spanish as a second language. Her father insisted that she sing in the language, but it was not easy for her. To maintain the story's celebratory air, it only lightly touches on Selena's relationship with her killer -- the actual shooting occurs off-screen. The after-effects of Selena's death are also only briefly presented(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 2. Part 2 of 4. N.W.A. evolves into a musical force but personal losses, a bitter contract dispute and a clash over management strain Dre's relationship with Easy-E. Meanwhile, Jimmy collaborates with Tom Petty, Stevie Nicks and U2(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 3. Part 3 of 4. Jimmy co-founds Interscope Records and cuts a deal with Death Row Records to become the label's distributor. But hostility mounts across America at the violence in rap music. Jimmy, Snoop Dogg and Tupac Shakur become embroiled in a violent feud with East Coast rap rivals, including Sean "Puffy" Combs and his Bad Boy Records(n)

programme.title: The Conjuring 2
programme.desc: Husband-and-wife paranormal investigators Ed (Patrick Wilson) and Lorraine Warren (Vera Farmiga) help a single mother living in 1977 London, who claims that she and her children are being terrorized by supernatural forces. Frances O'Connor, Franka Potente, and Simon McBurney co-star. This horror sequel was penned by sibling screenwriting duo Chad and Carey Hayes, and directed by James Wan(n)

programme.title: The Green Inferno
programme.desc: In this gruesome tribute to the Italian cannibal films of yesteryear, a group of young American activists on a mission to save the rain forest are captured by a sadistic tribe of flesh-eating locals(n)

programme.title: American Psycho
programme.desc: A Wall Street player (Christian Bale) basks in his late-1980s rich lifestyle, but behind his slick appearance lurks a murderous monster(n)

programme.title: Flight of the Conchords
programme.sub-title: Love Is the Weapon of Choice
programme.desc: Love Is the Weapon of Choice. The boys both fall in love with a girl they meet while out jogging, and so begins a competition between them for her attention, culminating in a benefit gig for the victims of canine epilepsy. Comedy series about Kiwi folk musicians Bret and Jemaine as they to try to make it big in New York(n)

programme.title: Victor Frankenstein
programme.desc: This re-imagining of the Frankenstein mythos focuses on Igor, the assistant of Victor Frankenstein. When the mad scientist builds an undead creature that soon becomes a grave danger, it's up to Igor to save Frankenstein from both the monster and himself(n)

programme.title: Brillo Box (3 ¢ off)
programme.desc: This documentary short traces the history of a sculpture of a Brillo Box by Andy Warhol, from its purchase by a couple in 1969 to its three-million-dollar auction in 2010. Directed by Lisanne Skyler(n)

In the aftermath of this unprecedented feat, he must endure the weight of sudden fame, second-guessing by investigators and his own doubts about his actions that fateful day(n)

programme.title: The Night Of
programme.desc: Part 1: The Beach. programme.desc: Action comedy about an undercover policeman who befriends a petty criminal so that he can acquire evidence to convict a drugs baron. But with the target in sight, things start to go disastrously wrong(n)

programme.title: Big Trouble
programme.desc: A chain of events starts with the arrival of a mysterious suitcase in Miami. Arthur Herk, a corrupt business owner, wants to get his hands on the case. At the same time, two hit men want him whacked(n)

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: Comic send-up of the long-running 1950s TV series. The strait-laced nephew of Sgt Joe Friday and his easy-going partner in the Los Angeles Police Department try to bust a criminal conspiracy between a pornographer and an evangelist(n)

programme.title: Nothing but Trouble
programme.desc: High-rolling financier Chris Thorne just wants to impress Diane Lightston when he invites her on a trip out of town. But when he is pulled over for a traffic violation in a bizarre small town, the couple and their wealthy Brazilia traveling companions become enmeshed in trouble--more trouble than they can handle(n)

programme.title: Down Periscope
programme.desc: Matthew Perry stars in this romcom. A one night stand in Las Vegas leads to pregnancy, marriage and - eventually - love(n)

programme.title: Blast From the Past
programme.desc: A naive man experiences the real world for the first time after being raised in a bomb shelter since the Cuban Missile Crisis. While stocking up on supplies for his still-underground parents, he falls for a cynical '90s gal in this charming rom com(n)

programme.title: The Sweetest Thing
programme.desc: Cameron Diaz is delightful in this offbeat romantic comedy, which is brimming with outrageous gross-out humor. Diaz plays lovelorn club-hopper Christina Walters, who finally finds her Mr. Right in dashing Peter Donahue (Thomas Jane). When Peter leaves town, she and her best friend hit the road so Christina can win his heart. Christina Applegate, Selma Blair, Parker Posey(n)

programme.title: Mr. Destiny
programme.desc: Drowning his sorrows after being fired, Larry finds a mysterious bartender who shows him the life he could have lived. Would he have been a different man if he'd hit that winning run as a kid?(n)

programme.title: Introducing the Dwights
programme.desc: Off-kilter coming-of-age comedy about an overbearing matriarch who sees her son's new girlfriend as a threat to their not-so-perfect family life(n)

programme.title: Friday
programme.desc: An unemployed young man avoids his father and a bully while trying to help his best friend pay back a debt to a drug dealer(n)

programme.title: Next Friday
programme.desc: Ice Cube returns as South Central L.A. slacker Craig Jones for this raucous sequel to 1995's "Friday." Jones hightails it to his lottery-winning uncle's suburban crib to hide from an escaped con he helped put in jail in the first film. Tom "Tiny" Lister Jr., Mike Epps, John Witherspoon(n)

programme.title: Fast Times at Ridgemont High
programme.desc: Director Amy Heckerling's hilarious teen movie follows brother and sister Brad and Stacy through a world of dead-end jobs, uninspiring classes, borrowed cars and sexual anxiety. Sean Penn is unforgettable as a stoned surfer(n)

programme.title: The Sweetest Thing
programme.desc: Cameron Diaz is delightful in this offbeat romantic comedy, which is brimming with outrageous gross-out humor. Diaz plays lovelorn club-hopper Christina Walters, who finally finds her Mr. Right in dashing Peter Donahue (Thomas Jane). When Peter leaves town, she and her best friend hit the road so Christina can win his heart. Christina Applegate, Selma Blair, Parker Posey(n)

programme.title: Now You See Me 2
programme.desc: In this wildly entertaining sequel, the illusionists known as the Four Horsemen return to perform a spectacular stunt in the hopes of clearing their names and exposing the unscrupulous behavior of a tech mogul. However, the mogul soon turns the tables, and forces the group to steal a revolutionary decrypting device for him(n)

programme.title: Next Day Air
programme.desc: An overnight shipment of drugs winds up being sent to the wrong recipient, prompting a frantic race to recover the package before the contents are discovered in this fast-paced crime comedy starring Donald Faison, Mos Def, and Mike Epps. When Brody (Epps) and Guch (Wood Harris) received package containing 10 kilos of grade-A cocaine, they assumed their financial woes were a thing of the past. The package was intended for their Brody and Guch's next-door neighbors, but the whacked-out courier (Donald Faison) delivered it to the wrong address. Recognizing the possibility for profit, the scheming duo plans to sell the cocaine to Brody's drug-dealing cousin (Omari Hardwick). Meanwhile Jesus (Cisco Reyes) and his girlfriend Chita (Yasmin Deliz), the intended recipients of the cocaine, set out to procure the package before notorious drug lord Bodego Diablo (Emilio Rivera) realizes it's gone missing. But Bodega is no slouch; he already knows the shipment was botched, and he's determined to get his drugs back no matter what the cost. Later, as Brody and Guch prepare to seal the deal that will set them up for life, the guns are drawn and the chaos begins(n)

programme.title: Nothing but Trouble
programme.desc: High-rolling financier Chris Thorne just wants to impress Diane Lightston when he invites her on a trip out of town. But when he is pulled over for a traffic violation in a bizarre small town, the couple and their wealthy Brazilia traveling companions become enmeshed in trouble--more trouble than they can handle(n)

programme.title: Dim Sum Funeral
programme.desc: Death brings a contentious family together (though that doesn't mean they get along) in this comedy-drama from director Anna Chi. When elderly Mrs. Xiao (Lisa Lu) dies in her sleep at home, her housekeeper and close friend Viola (Talia Shire) contacts her four adult children in hopes they'll come home to help with the funeral. Unfortunately, Mrs. Xiao didn't have many friends besides Viola, her children all have issues with her, and given her zeal to assimilate into American culture, the siblings are more than puzzled that she insisted upon a traditional Chinese funeral lasting a full seven days. Alexander (Russell Wong), a successful doctor, is still coming to terms with his overly strict mother and philandering father, and is unexpectedly reunited with his ex-wife (Kelly Hu), who he lost through his own infidelity. Elizabeth (Julia Nickson), a writer, also crosses paths with her former spouse (Adrian Hough) while she mourns both her mother and her young son. Victoria (Francoise Yip) has never been able to forgive her mom after she rejected her for marrying an African-American. And MeiMei (Steph Song), an actress, is a lesbian who wants to have children with her significant other Deedee (Bai Ling); they've been having trouble finding a suitable sperm donor, though they think one of the monks at the funeral may be just what they're looking for. Dim Sum Funeral received its world premiere at the 2008 AFI Fest(n)

programme.title: He Said, She Said
programme.desc: A romantic comedy with a dual perspective, as Kevin Bacon and Elizabeth Perkins, two Baltimore journalists, swap respective accounts of their love affair and subsequent break-up. Two different directors - one male, one female - present the audience with each side of the same story as the protagonists discuss their relationship and its eventual dissolution on a TV talk-show(n)

programme.title: Le Divorce
programme.desc: Based on the 1997 National Book Award-nominated novel of the same name by Diane Johnson (co-writer of the script for Stanley Kubrick's The Shining), Le Divorce is a romantic comedy from director James Ivory. Revisiting the "Americans in France" theme that Ivory explored in 1998's A Soldier's Daughter Never Cries, the film stars Kate Hudson as Isabel Walker. When she receives word that her pregnant poetess sister Roxy (Naomi Watts) has been left by her philandering French husband, artist Charles-Henri de Persand (Melvil Poupaud), Isabel offers her help and moral support. As the depressive Roxy struggles with the separation proceedings -- which include the rights to ownership of a work of art that's a family heirloom -- Isabel takes a job with author Olivia Pace and has a fling with the bohemian Yves (Romain Duris). But things get complicated when the younger, more impudent sister decides instead to pursue Charles' uncle, the snooty, married diplomat Edgar (Thierry Lhermitte), and when a mysterious man (Matthew Modine) starts stalking Roxy. Eventually, the rest of the plucky Walker clan has to come to the aid of the siblings. Stockard Channing and Sam Waterston co-star(n)

programme.title: Robin Hood: Men in Tights
programme.desc: A veteran of the Crusades brings together a ragtag group to do battle against an evil king, and gets help from a surprising source inside the royal castle, in this spoof of the Robin Hood legend(n)

programme.title: Blues Brothers 2000
programme.desc: After their first adventure, Elwood was given a prison sentence of 18 years. Upon release he learns that his former partner Jake has died. Determined to get the band back together, he picks up 10-year-old Buster and Mack McTeer. They travel across the country to Louisiana for a battle of the bands(n)

programme.title: Keeping Up With the Joneses
programme.desc: An ordinary suburban couple discover that their hospitable new neighbors are actually government spies. Soon, all four of them are caught up in an international espionage imbroglio(n)

programme.title: Renaissance Man
programme.desc: An out-of-work exec reluctantly takes a job teaching English to a group of underachieving Army recruits to help them complete basic training. He bonds with them by introducing them to Shakespeare, and clashes with an unimpressed Drill Sergeant(n)

programme.title: Parenthood
programme.desc: This feel-good ensemble comedy tracks a quartet of suburban siblings and their families over the course of a single summer. Hardworking Gil Buckman (Steve Martin) and his stay-at-home wife, Karen (Mary Steeenburgen), have just a few months to help their oldest son, Kevin (Jasen Fisher), overcome his high-strung behavior problems before he'll be relegated to special-education classes. Gil's difficult relationship with his own father, Frank (Jason Robards), has led him to become a would-be super-dad for his three kids, so he takes his son's difficulties more than a little personally. Gil's sister, Helen (Dianne Wiest), is trying to raise a moody, adolescent son (Leaf Phoenix) and an independent-minded daughter (Martha Plimpton) with no help from her well-off ex-husband, who's more interested in his new wife and family. Gil and Helen's sister, Susan (Harley Jane Kozak), meanwhile, must participate in the too-scripted Big Life Plans of her anal-retentive husband, Nathan (Rick Moranis), whose overachiever zeal infects even their toddler daughter. When long-lost brother Larry (Tom Hulce) show up with yet another get-rich-quick scheme, he brings with him a surprise addition to the family. Screenwriters Babaloo Mandel, Lowell Ganz, and Ron Howard negotiate their varied subplots with a deftness and comedic touch that transforms this conflicted clan into a suburban everyfamily(n)

programme.title: Le Divorce
programme.desc: Based on the 1997 National Book Award-nominated novel of the same name by Diane Johnson (co-writer of the script for Stanley Kubrick's The Shining), Le Divorce is a romantic comedy from director James Ivory. As the depressive Roxy struggles with the separation proceedings -- which include the rights to ownership of a work of art that's a family heirloom -- Isabel takes a job with author Olivia Pace and has a fling with the bohemian Yves (Romain Duris). But things get complicated when the younger, more impudent sister decides instead to pursue Charles' uncle, the snooty, married diplomat Edgar (Thierry Lhermitte), and when a mysterious man (Matthew Modine) starts stalking Roxy. Eventually, the rest of the plucky Walker clan has to come to the aid of the siblings. Stockard Channing and Sam Waterston co-star(n)

programme.desc: An ordinary suburban couple discover that their hospitable new neighbors are actually government spies. Soon, all four of them are caught up in an international espionage imbroglio(n)

programme.title: What Women Want
programme.desc: Mel Gibson stars in this charming romantic comedy about a chauvinistic executive at a Chicago advertising agency. programme.title: Inkheart
programme.desc: Iain Softley's CGI fantasy adventure about a man with an extraordinary talent - and the consequences of his using it - stars Brendan Fraser, Paul Bettany and Andy Serkis. Mo Folchart is a 'silvertongue' - someone who possesses the ability to summon forth characters from the pages of novels and bring them into physical being in the real world. But it's a gift he does his best to hide from the rest of us, because there's a terrible price to be paid: each time a fictional character is brought to life, the vacuum created within the written work must be filled by a real-life person. And this is how his wife Resa came to vanish, after he manifested three ne'er-do-wells from a story. At first he refuses to help one of them, Dustfinger. But then Dustfinger teams up with the rather more focused criminal Capricorn, who has plans to force Mo to use his talents to provide him with gargantuan wealth and power. Thus Mo and his daughter Meggie are left little choice but to set out to thwart the villains' intentions - and rescue their loved ones from literary purgatory(n)

programme.title: Disney's The Kid
programme.desc: If you could talk to the child that you used to be, what advice would you give him? That question forms the basis of this comic fantasy. Forty-year-old Russ Duritz (Bruce Willis) is a wealthy and powerful "image consultant" who has made a career out of telling people how to present themselves. But while he's a success in business, he's a failure in life; he's vain, mean-spirited, and hasn't been able to hold onto a marriage (or even a pet dog). One day, Russ is startled to meet Rusty (Spencer Breslin), a stocky kid whom he soon realizes is himself at the age of eight, having passed through a wrinkle in time. Young Rusty doesn't seem much happier than the grown-up Russ, so the older man takes his younger self under his wing and tries to teach him how to avoid the mistakes he's made, while Rusty encourages Russ to be a more caring human being. Along the way, Russ and Rusty become friends, and realize how much they can learn from each other. Disney's The Kid also stars Jean Smart as one of Russ' clients, Lily Tomlin as his assistant, and Daniel Von Bargen as his father(n)

programme.title: The Great Muppet Caper
programme.desc: The Great Muppet Caper is the second Muppet film and it is considerably more complex than its predecessor, The Muppet Movie, which was essentially just a road movie. As the film begins, Kermit the Frog and Fozzie Bear are reporters who have failed to bag a story of a London jewel heist, which happened under their watch. The real criminals managed to escape and frame Miss Piggy as the thief. Kermit, Fozzie and the Great Gonzo set out on a mission to solve the mystery and track down the criminals who stole the Baseball Diamond. There are fewer star cameos and songs in The Great Muppet Caper than in The Muppet Movie, although appearances from John Cleese and Charles Grodin are particularly memorable(n)

programme.title: Astro Boy
programme.desc: In this animated adventure, an eccentric scientist builds a robot child known as Astro Boy (voice of Freddie Highmore) based on his deceased son. programme.title: Hairspray
programme.desc: Adam Shankman's adaptation of the 2002 musical (itself an adaptation of John Waters' 1988 original movie) stars John Travolta, Queen Latifah and Nikki Blonsky. Teen Tracy Turnblad's regular cultural highlight is a local television music-and-dance programme called The Corny Collins Show. And, like all her friends, she dreams of having a chance to appear on it. However, this is Baltimore and it is 1962 - and Tracy's both overweight and, worse, has liberal attitudes to race relations, which don't sit comfortably with the segregationist views of the show's producer. But, could Tracy's ambitions for not only appearing on the show, but also racially integrating it, receive a fillip when she meets the son of Motormouth Maybelle, host of the monthly 'Negro Day' edition of the show? Also starring John Travolta (in drag and a fat-suit) as Tracy's mum, Christopher Walken, as her dad, and Amanda Bynes, James Marsden, Brittany Snow, Zac Efron and Elijah Kelley; plus cameos from the star of the original movie, Ricki Lake, and its director, John Waters(n)

programme.title: The Breakfast Club

programme.title: Soul Food
programme.desc: Warm and touching family drama centred around a plentifully stocked dinner table. Mamma Joe, the matriarch of an extended African American family, lays on famous Sunday 'soul food' feasts at which the family come together and resolve their differences. However, when Mamma Joe falls ill the family begins to fracture, leaving one young man, Ahmad - through whose eyes the story is told - trying to keep the relatives from descending into all-out war(n)

programme.title: Journey to the Center of the Earth
programme.desc: Academy Award-winning visual effects artist Eric Brevig makes his feature directorial debut with this adaptation of the classic Jules Verne fantasy starring Brendan Fraser. When an ambitious science professor (Fraser) develops a decidedly unconventional hypothesis, the mere mention of his name is enough to elicit laughter within the academic community. However, during a subsequent excursion to Iceland, the professor and his nephew make a major scientific discovery that sends them miles beneath the surface of the Earth, where they discover not only strange new worlds, but also encounter creatures so alien they appear to be from another world entirely(n)

Spike Lee's colorful, jazz-fueled drama follows Bleek's attempts to juggle his friends, lovers, and, most importantly, his music(n)

programme.title: The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen

programme.title: Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children
programme.desc: In this wondrous fantasy adventure, a boy follows a series of clues that lead him to a mysterious orphanage on a remote Welsh island. There, he discovers a community of children with unusual abilities, and learns he is destined to protect them(n)

programme.title: The Cell
programme.desc: In this science fiction thriller, child psychiatrist Catherine Deane (Jennifer Lopez) has developed a technique that allows her to travel through the minds of her patients. When Stargher (Vincent D'Onofrio), a multiple murderer who methodically drowns his victims and performs bizarre rituals with their bodies, falls into a coma, FBI agent Peter Novak (Vince Vaughn) asks Deane to enter the killer's psyche, in the hope of finding a missing girl whom Stargher has kidnapped; if she's not soon found, in all likelihood she'll die in his torture cell. However, once Deane enters the bizarre world of Stargher's mind, she finds getting out to be a very difficult matter. The Cell was the first feature from director Tarsem, who previously made award-winning commercials and music videos, including the video for R.E.M.'s "Losing My Religion." The supporting cast includes Catherine Sutherland, Marianne Jean-Baptiste, Dylan Baker, and Pruitt Taylor Vince(n)

programme.title: Loving
programme.desc: Enthralling biopic about Virginian interracial couple Richard and Mildred Loving, whose arrest in 1958 for violating the state's miscegenation laws eventually led to a landmark Supreme Court decision(n)

programme.title: Fire Down Below
programme.desc: An EPA marshal (Steven Seagal) goes undercover in a mining community to investigate the murder of a friend. He joins forces with two locals, and they embark on a quest to stop a treacherous corporation that has been illegally dumping toxic waste. Marg Helgenberger, Harry Dean Stanton, Stephen Lang(n)

programme.title: The Happening
programme.desc: Lady in the Water director M. Night Shyamalan puts PG-13 suspense on pause to tell this grim apocalyptic tale about a family fleeing a natural disaster that poses a grave threat to the whole of humanity. Philadelphia high-school science teacher Elliot Moore (Mark Wahlberg) is discussing the disappearance of the bees with his students when the staff is summoned to the theater and briefed about a mysterious event that is currently unfolding in New York City. According to reports, citizens in the vicinity of Central Park have suddenly and inexplicably begun seizing up just before killing themselves by whatever means are at their disposal. As the phenomena begins to spread and talk of terrorism fills the airwaves, Elliot, his wife, Alma (Zooey Deschanel), their friend Julian (John Leguizamo), and his daughter, Jess (Ashlyn Sanchez), board a train bound for the presumed safety of the country. When the train screeches to a halt before arriving at its final destination, however, the frightened passengers are forced to fend for themselves as each consecutive news report paints an increasingly grim picture of the situation in more urbanized areas. Theories abound on what could be causing the unexplainable rash of suicides, but the only thing that everyone seems to agree on is that it's some kind of airborne contagion that is carried in the wind. It would appear that humankind's reign on planet Earth has come to an end, but perhaps if this small band of survivors can find a safe place to lie low until this all blows over, all hope for survival of the species might not be lost just yet(n)

programme.title: Speed
programme.desc: Keanu Reeves plays Jack Traven, a young cop working with the LAPD bomb squad. Thwarting mad bomber Howard Payne, who has wired up a lift to explode, Traven finds himself the object of revenge. Payne rigs a bomb to a bus which arms when the speed reaches above 50mph and explodes if it drops beneath. With passenger Annie Porter drafted in to replace the injured driver, Traven has to work out how to disarm the bomb and evacuate the passengers while she keeps the bus up to speed in urban LA. Jan de Bont's thriller piles on the action and even after Traven saves everyone on the bus, there's still a roller-coaster finale on a runaway subway train commandeered by Payne(n)

programme.title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice
programme.desc: Batman and Superman clash over differing philosophies about what kind of heroism is needed to protect the world in this soaring comic-book extravaganza. However, the duo are soon forced to confront an even greater threat created by Lex Luthor(n)

programme.title: The Clearing
programme.desc: Director Pieter Jan Brugge's first film stars Robert Redford as Wayne Hayes, a rich, successful businessman, and Helen Mirren as his wife Eileen. When Wayne leaves for work one morning, he is kidnapped by Arnold Mack and led, bound, deeper and deeper into the woods. Eileen, eventually realising he's missing, calls in the FBI in the person of agent Ray Fuller. But what could have been a conventional procedural is lifted to another level as Brugge switches between the developing relationship between Wayne and Arnold, and the uncomfortable truths Ray extracts from Eileen, or learns from other sources, becoming as much a story about their marriage as the crime(n)

programme.title: Snow Angels
programme.desc: This powerful tale of jealousy and murder in a small town centers on a waitress (Kate Beckinsale) separating from her unstable husband (Sam Rockwell), and a high-school student dealing with his first romance and his parents' own breakup. Michael Angarano, Nicky Katt, Jeannetta Arnette, Griffin Dunne, Tom Noonan. Directed by David Gordon Green(n)

programme.title: Sixteen Candles
programme.desc: On the eve of her sister's wedding, suburban teenager Samantha suffers silently as her family forgets her birthday. Even worse, some total dork keeps propositioning her with sophomoric innuendo when she really craves romantic attention from high-school hunk Jake. This bittersweet teen comedy traces the hopes and disappointments not only of Samantha, but also a host of incidental but memorable characters..(n)

programme.title: Girl with a Pearl Earring
programme.desc: Screen adaptation of Tracy Chevalier's bestselling novel, inspired by the Johannes Vermeer painting of the same name. Set in mid-17th century Delft, Holland, 17-year-old Griet is forced into servanthood when her father suffers an accident and becomes unable to work. programme.title: Phone Booth
programme.desc: (2002) In Joel Schumacher's taut thriller, told in real time, cynical, smarmy PR man Stu Shepard (Colin Farrell) picks up a ringing phone in a booth on a busy New York street to find a killer on the line. Armed with a high-powered sniper's rifle, the anonymous caller soon proves his prowess and presents Shepard with a choice: convince the police of his story before they shoot him or drop the phone and be shot. His only hope lies in self-abasement and facing up to the truths of his life(n)

programme.title: The Blair Witch Project
programme.desc: Combining Hi-8 video with black-and-white 16 mm film, this film presents a raw look at what can happen when college students forego common sense and enter the world of voodoo and witchcraft. Presented as a straightforward documentary, the film opens with a title card explaining that in 1994, three students went into the Maryland back woods to do a film project on the Blair Witch incidents. These kids were never seen again, and the film you are about to see is from their recovered equipment, found in the woods a year later. The entire movie documents their adventures leading up to their final minutes. The Blair Witch incident, as we initially learn from the local town elders, is an old legend about a group of witches who tortured and killed several children many years ago. Everyone in town knows the story and they're all sketchy on the details. Out in the woods and away from their parked car (and civilization), what starts as a school exercise turns into a nightmare when the three kids lose their map. Forced to spend extra days finding their way out, the kids then start to hear horrific sounds outside their tents in the pitch-black middle of night. They also find strange artifacts from (what can only be) the Blair Witch, still living in the woods. Frightened, they desperately try to find their way out of the woods, with no luck. Slowly these students start to unravel, knowing they have no way of getting out, no food, and it's getting cold. Each night they are confronted with shrieking and sounds so haunting that they are convinced someone is following them, and they quickly begin to fear for their lives. The film premiered in the midnight movie section at the 1999 Sundance Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Jawbreaker
programme.desc: At Ronald Reagan High School, the power elite clique consists of Courtney, Julie, Marcie, and Liz. Since Liz threatens Courtney's desire to become prom queen, Courtney convinces Marcie and Julie to kidnap Liz and force her to eat until she's too fat to win. Of course, things go terribly wrong(n)

programme.title: Cruel Intentions
programme.desc: A loose adaptation of Choderlos De Laclos' 1782 novel Les Liaissons Dangereuses (which has been filmed three times before), Cruel Intentions revamps the story by moving it to the United States in the late 1990's and revising the context from royal romantic intrigue to teenage trechery among the filthy rich. Sarah Michelle Geller plays Kathryn, a beautiful but cold-hearted and manipulative young woman who enjoys making wagers with her jaded step-brother Sebastian (Ryan Phillippe). When Kathryn's boyfriend breaks off with her because he's infatuated with the less worldly Cecile (Selma Blair), Kathryn challenges Sebastian to seduce Cecile in order to ruin her new love. Sebastian reluctantly agrees, but is far more intrigued with a newer challenge -- Annette (Reese Witherspoon), the daughter of his private school's headmaster, who is intelligent, beautiful and has appeared in "Seventeen" magazine proudly announcing she intends to remain a virgin until the day she's married. Katheryn and Sebastian make a new bet: if he can bed Annette before the end of summer vacation, Katheryn will spend a debauched evening with him, but if he fails, she'll take ownership of his prized 1956 Jaguar. Supporting cast includes Swoozie Kurtz, who has gone this route before, having appeared in Stephen Frears' period adaptation of this story, Dangerous Liasons(n)

programme.title: The Craft
programme.desc: Atmospheric supernatural horror tale in which four outsiders at an elite school form a witches' coven, using their occult powers to make their wishes come true and seek revenge for their exclusion. Dubbed the Bitches of Eastwick by their fellow students, they revel in their freedom to 'exorcise their rites'. But they discover that there is a terrible price to pay when their witchery goes wrong(n)

programme.title: Fargo
programme.desc: Big Brother's Anna Nolan introduces her second pic of the night. The Coen Brothers multi-award-winning film (two Oscars, best director at Cannes, five BAFTAs) stars Frances McDormand as the heavily pregnant, slow-speaking but quick-witted Chief of Police of a small Minnesotan town who suddenly finds she has three murders on her hands as kidnappers Steve Buscemi and Peter Stormare happen to pass through(n)

programme.title: Se7en

programme.title: Pulp Fiction
programme.desc: Oscar-winning black comedy about the activities of a disparate group of LA lowlifes, giving a 90s spin to formulaic popular crime stories of the 50s - pulp fiction. A hit man falls for his boss's wife when he is asked to escort her on a date; a boxer reneges on his promise to throw a big fight; and a couple attempt a heist that rapidly escalates out of control. Controversial winner of the Palme d'Or at Cannes(n)

programme.desc: Steve from Blackpool searches for his birth mother who gave him up for adoption when he was a baby. After her partner tragically died when she was only 17-years-old, she had no choice but to try and find a new family for her son, and put an advert in the local paper to try and find him the best possible parents. Meanwhile, Corine searches for the son she gave up for adoption when she was just 15-years-old, but fears he may not forgive her once he finds out she has since adopted two other children.(n)

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and his team head to Hythe, Hampshire to create a sensory outdoor space for a four-year-old girl with severely limited vision, who will one day go completely blind. The team transform the family's current bland garden into a safe family haven where little Isabelle can learn about the outside world in a comfortable environment.(n)

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The chef visits the region of Jura, where a local farmer shows him around his orchards and teaches him about the region's apples and pears, which James uses as the accompaniment in a barbecued duck. He also visits Fort des Rousses, the old military stronghold that is now used for the making of Comte, one of the country's most popular cheeses.(n)

programme.title: Rebound
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher hosts the quickfire quiz that tests the general knowledge of six contestants, who go head to head in a bid to walk away with a big cash prize.
