programme.title: Women's Rugby World Cup 2017
programme.desc: England v Italy (Kick-off 2.30pm). Jill Douglas presents coverage of both teams' second Pool B contest, held at Billings Park UCD in Dublin. England are the defending champions, while Italy have qualified for the first time since 2002. With analysis from Maggie Alphonsi and David Flatman, and commentary by Nick Mullins and Catherine Spencer.(n)

programme.title: Bear Grylls Survival School
programme.desc: Callum, Abbie and Jasmine all become ill, leaving the rest of the survival students to battle it out in a raft challenge and cliff climb. John rescues a vital cache of food - but the good fortune is not enough to stop one of the group returning home.(n)

programme.title: All Star Family Fortunes
programme.desc: Former X Factor winner Sam Bailey and Loose Women panellist Jamelia are joined by their families to answer a series of seemingly simple questions based on a survey of 100 members of the public. The winning team then goes on to the Big Money round, where a jackpot of £30,000 can be won for charity. Vernon Kay hosts the long-running game show.(n)

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Melanie Sykes, Heather Small, Andrew Castle and Graeme Le Saux pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.(n)

programme.title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
programme.desc: The dark lord Voldemort rises to ultimate power over the magical world, so the teenage wizard and his friends set out on a mission to find the magical horcruxes - artefacts containing parts of the evil wizard's soul that hold the key to destroying him. The first half of the two-part conclusion to the fantasy saga, starring Daniel Radcliffe, Ralph Fiennes, Emma Watson and Rupert Grint.(n)

programme.title: Judge Rinder's Crime Stories
programme.desc: Barrister Robert Rinder examines the UK's biggest ever drugs bust, carried out by the Border Force and the National Crime Agency. Plus, a robbery in the small Kent town of Tonbridge in which £53million was stolen - the largest ammount of cash stolen in British history. Last in the series.(n)

However, they must get the female participants to keep their lights on as a sign of approval.(n)

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.(n)

programme.title: Cash Trapped
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Bradley Walsh in which six contestants battle it out across a series of fast-paced question rounds where the players must actively try to sabotage their opponents by beating them to the buzzer and trapping them out of the game. In the final round of each episode, the person who has earned the most cash will go head to head against the rest of the group to try to take their winnings home.(n)

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Emma is alarmed when Finn announces that he is clearing all their possessions out of Wylie's farm, and worries about what he might find. Leyla reflects on how nothing in her life seems to go according to plan and fears that her wedding might go the same way. Megan realises that she is in too deep.(n)

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Eva gets cold feet over her revenge plan, and Gemma's attempt to impress her mates Zoe and Roxy leaves Rita fuming when they raid her drinks cupboard. Meanwhile, Chesney's behaviour provides cause for concern, and Sally is concerned about Gina's spending habits.(n)

programme.title: Countrywise
programme.desc: Ben Fogle tries his hand at competitive sheep shearing in north Wales and Liz Bonnin is on the Isle of Mull, spotting pods of migrating dolphins who are returning to the shores. Plus, a visit to the Sussex home of Zoe Ball, who gives a tour of her own back garden before heading off to the National Trust's Standen House for some tips on how to make her garden grow.(n)

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Jenny's outraged by Eva's suggestion of a double wedding, while Zoe and Roxy spot an opportunity after Rita forgets to lock the shop. Elsewhere, Norris is shocked when Mary reveals that Jude is flying his family over for their fake wedding, and Chesney snaps at Cathy.(n)

programme.title: easyJet: Inside the Cockpit
programme.desc: New series. Brits took more flights than ever before in 2016 and with air travel increasing there is now a worldwide shortage of pilots and easyJet has launched its largest-ever recruitment drive, including a focus on encouraging more women to apply. This documentary following new recruits for airline easyJet as they train to become fully qualified pilots, going inside the cockpit and tracking the candidates from the classroom to the simulator, and eventually to their first flight with hundreds of paying passengers. Stephen Fry narrates.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Busiest Motorway

As the big getaway begins, traffic officers Howard and Tim are called to a big pile-up in heavy traffic. At Junction 4 of the M20, a truck has hit a pedestrian bridge forcing it to collapse onto the carriageway.(n)

programme.title: Sugar Free Farm

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: As the sole witness to a dying man's last words, Bobby Attfield is determined to solve the riddle they present, and forms an unlikely alliance with socialite Frankie Derwent and visiting family friend Miss Marple to help him on his quest. A trail of clues leads them to Castle Savage, where they uncover a hotbed of stifled emotion, treachery and deceit among its strange inhabitants. Murder mystery, starring Julia McKenzie, with a supporting cast that includes Sean Biggerstaff, Samantha Bond, Richard Briers, Rafe Spall, Warren Clarke, Mark Williams, Georgia Moffett, Helen Lederer and Rik Mayall.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: The glamorous Ruth Van Rydock contacts her old friend Jane Marple with a mystery - her sister Carrie Louise's study has been devastated by a suspicious fire. While Carrie Louise has the same cheerful outlook as ever, Ruth fears dark forces are at play at Stonygates, the home Carrie shares with her third husband, various relatives and a motley crew of young criminals, the latest subject of Carrie's philanthropic endeavours. But on the evening before a theatrical show is staged for their guests, one of whom is Miss Marple, an even more fascinating performance takes place before their very eyes - one where the final act is murder. Julia McKenzie stars, with guest appearances from Joan Collins, Penelope Wilton, Brian Cox, Maxine Peake, Alexei Sayle, Sarah Smart, Ian Ogilvy, Sean Hughes and Nigel Terry.(n)

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Dr Alan Delaney is killed by a hit-and-run driver while in charge of his partner's new car, Barnaby and Jones discover the dead man had once been accused by Dr James Kirkwood of stealing a large sum of money from their Midsomer Market practice. Further investigations to uncover the whereabouts of the missing money lead the detectives to believe that Kirkwood may have been the real target. Guest starring Stephanie Cole (Doc Martin), with John Nettles and Jason Hughes.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Brooks and Devlin investigate when former top-flight footballer Robbie Nichols is murdered in the East End of London, in what appears to be a robbery gone wrong. They question a man seen in the area on the night of the killing, who protests his innocence and points the finger at a known gangster he claims was also at the scene. With the detectives at odds over who to believe, Steel finds it increasingly difficult to prosecute the accused. Bradley Walsh, Jamie Bamber and Ben Daniels star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: High-court judge Rachel Callaghan (guest star Juliet Stevenson) is critically injured after being shot in the underground car park of her apartment. When it becomes clear a hitman was responsible, the team tries to discover who hired him. As evidence mounts against the accused, the judge's health deteriorates, and Castle is faced with a choice between friendship and respect for a person's right to die. Bill Paterson, Bradley Walsh and Freema Agyeman star.(n)

Drama, starring Robson Green, with Mark Letheren and John Hopkins.(n)

programme.title: Wire in the Blood

Drama, starring Robson Green, with Simone Lahbib and Mark Letheren.(n)

Gary Anderson was the triumphant player last year, defeating Raymond van Barneveld in the last four, before overcoming Adrian Lewis in the showpiece match. The two-time world champion returned to defend his crown this year, along with van Barneveld and the other invited PDC players Peter Wright, James Wade, Daryl Gurney, Phil Taylor, Michael Smith and Simon Whitlock. Lewis and reigning world champion Michael van Gerwen will not be taking part this time around, however. With commentary by Stuart Pyke, Rod Harrington and Glen Larmer.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone

The drama is based on real events in the Sherlock Holmes creator's life, as he pursues a notorious miscarriage of justice. It's 1906, and Sir Arthur and his trusted secretary Alfred `Woodie' Wood investigate the case of George Edalji, a young Anglo-Indian solicitor who was imprisoned for allegedly mutilating animals and writing obscene letters. programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Housewife Pip Massey welcomes the diners to her home for the second dinner party of the week in the Crewe and Nantwich area of Cheshire. programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Landscape gardener Darren Leech hosts the third dinner party in and around Crewe and Nantwich, Cheshire. He hopes to impress his guests with fine food, including smoked haddock and black pudding, and entertainment that involves laughing at his bottom.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Student Emma Davies hosts the fourth dinner party in the Crewe and Nantwich area of Cheshire, hoping to woo her guests with a creative menu featuring stuffed pork and a home-made gnocchi starter as well as treating them to a musical performance.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hypnotherapist Russell Stubbs hosts the final dinner party in Crewe and Nantwich, Cheshire, hoping to impress his guests with a rock-night theme. programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at Swallows Rest in Weymouth, Dorset, where hosts Jane and Keith Smith are pulling out all the stops to win. However, the colour combinations in the rooms do not go down well with rival B&B owner Ray Chowdhury, and an afternoon of drawing starts some competition between Ray and newlyweds James and Darren Kosa-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants visit the Burley Inn in the New Forest, where newlyweds Darren and James welcome their guests. Donna and David prove to have a critical eye when they discover holes in the sheets, and Jane and Keith have a disagreement over a toilet roll. In the afternoon, the couple reveal their quizmaster skills, before Ray grills them on how they run their B&B over dinner.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to Hotel Montville in Redditch, Worcestershire for the third day of the competition, where first impressions of Ray Chowdhury's unique style and decor are positive. However, room inspections leave Jane and Keith Smith threatening not to stay, and the guests grill their host about his business background at dinner. Although some light relief is given in the form of ice sculpting, breakfast disappoints James and Darren Kosa-Jones, and Ray must face the harsh reality of his guests' opinions at feedback.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit is to Donna and David's Silverton B&B in Shrewsbury, where the complimentary earplugs soon have Darren and James worrying about the noise from the road outside. A Segway race helps whip up the guests' competitive spirit, Donna gets emotional when her work-life balance is questioned, and chef David proves he can handle the unexpected at breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and settle some scores. Accusations fly around the table as payments are revealed and the winner announced. Swallows Rest is first up and hosts Jane and Keith want to find out about Ray's colour preferences. Next Darren and James of the Burley Inn quiz Ray over his fussiness around their pine furniture. When it comes to the Silverton, B&B team Donna and David take umbrage with Jane and Keith's comments.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Fitness instructor Liza Macias hosts the first party in Warwickshire and hopes wooing her diners with a French menu and three hunky waiters will be enough to win her the £1,000 prize at the end of the week.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Sailor Steve Aston hosts the second dinner party in Warwickshire, hoping his nautical-themed evening will impress the women in the group and win him the £1,000 prize. But what will the ladies think when they discover the secrets of his `love ship'?.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Admin manager Emma Reddin hosts the third dinner party in Warwickshire, and hopes to secure the £1,000 prize by offering her guests pea and potato samosas and a selection of Indian curries, and organising Bollywood dancing.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: PA Pinky Sidhu hosts the fourth dinner party in Warwickshire, hoping to educate her guests about the finer things in life with an evening of sophistication and pageantry. However, the diners quickly find fault with her starter and dessert, and there is a surprise winner of the beauty competition she arranged as entertainment.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Driving instructor Alison Firth hosts the final dinner party in Warwickshire, and hopes that her 1980s disco-themed night featuring a marshmallow competition will impress her guests enough to see her win the cash prize.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: At Chester Zoo, Rothschild giraffe Tula is a week overdue after a 13-month pregnancy. But keepers are anxious that history could repeat itself - she gave birth to a stillborn calf last year. Cameras also follow this year's brood of penguin chicks. They are about to face the ordeal of joining the main pool, where they must compete for fish with the adult penguins. And baby silvery gibbon Eko learns how to swing between ropes - 50 feet up.(n)

programme.title: Paul O'Grady's Hollywood
programme.desc: Paul looks at how movie heroines went from damsels in distress to kick-ass action movie heroines such as Sigourney Weaver in Alien and Uma Thurman in Kill Bill. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: A smooth-talking priest offers Ted a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to leave Craggy Island and run his own parish in Beverly Hills, but first he has to tell Jack, Dougal and Mrs Doyle that they are not invited. Final episode of the clerical comedy, starring Dermot Morgan, with Tommy Tiernan, Jeff Harding and a cameo appearance by music star Brian Eno.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: The first episode of the hit comedy. The Craggy Island cleric dreams of achieving stardom on the Faith of Our Fathers TV show - but his hopes are dashed by Jack and Dougal's untimely intervention. Dermot Morgan, Ardal O'Hanlon and Frank Kelly star.(n)

programme.title: Small, Far Away: The World of Father Ted
programme.desc: Documentary first shown in 2011 following Graham Linehan and Arthur Mathews, who created Father Ted, as they embark on a road trip across Ireland in celebration of the 15th anniversary of the comedy's birth. They revisit some of the key locations from the series, and reflect on how producer Geoffrey Perkins suggested turning a one-off spoof documentary into a sitcom. With contributions by Ardal O'Hanlon, Frank Kelly, Graham Norton and more.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the famous quiz, with team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson joined by guests Dara O Briain and Sharon Horgan. Countdown regular Susie Dent is assisted in Dictionary Corner by Adam Buxton, while Rachel Riley provides the letters and numbers with a little help from Joe Wilkinson.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef heads to floundering soul food restaurant Blackberry's in Plainfield, New Jersey, but struggles to get his message across to indomitable owner Shelley. Her refusal to deal with the truth comes to a head when Gordon finds a dead mouse in the doorway, prompting him to step up his efforts to change her ways.(n)

programme.title: Paul O'Grady's Hollywood
programme.desc: Paul looks at how movie heroines went from damsels in distress to kick-ass action movie heroines such as Sigourney Weaver in Alien and Uma Thurman in Kill Bill. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Uncut
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts an extended edition of the irreverent panel show, joined by team captains Jon Richardson and Sean Lock. The pair welcome guests including boxer Amir Khan, comedienne Holly Walsh, IT Crowd star Richard Ayoade and comedian Josh Widdicombe, who answer questions based on opinion polls carried out around the country.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: A couple disagree over where to spend their retirement, with husband Michael hoping to set up home in Derbyshire, where he will be able to indulge his passion for the British countryside. Conversely, his wife Susan would like to spend her time relaxing by a pool in the Spanish sun, and it is left up to Laura Hamilton and Jasmine Harman to help them decide where to spend their £180,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: A couple with very different ideas of how they want to spend their retirement seek advice from Jonnie Irwin and Jasmine Harman. While husband Tony plans on returning to the Wirral in Merseyside, his wife Karin hopes to move to southern Spain, where her sister has already settled.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at Who'd a Thought It in Grafty Green, Kent, where partners Joe Mallett and Alex Rea Baldwin hope to impress their fellow guests. On arrival, Liz and Brian are excited over their two hot tubs, and Jackie and Paul are more than happy with the complimentary champagne. However, Matthew and Liam are underwhelmed by the cleanliness levels.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners visit the New Osborne Hotel in Blackpool on their second night, where proprietor Matthew Bracegirdle and entertainment manager Liam hope their guests feel at home in their family friendly establishment. However, Jackie and Paul are unimpressed by their small room, and Joe and Alex find the cleanliness levels lacking.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to the Fairy Falls Hotel in Trefriw, Conwy County Borough, where B&B newcomers Jackie and Paul Langshaw hope to impress the other contestants. They take their guests to a local maze in the afternoon and, after an uncomfortable night's sleep for Alex, some of the breakfast orders are misplaced.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Husband and wife Liz and Brian Jardine welcome their guests to The Great Trewern B&B, Llandrindod Wells, Powys, where they enjoy the quiet life. Joe and Alex feel far away from it all, but the shared bathroom facilities fail to impress the other guests. At dinner, talk turns to first impressions and it appears it is all water under the bridge for Jackie and Joe, but she remains upset with the feedback Matthew and Liam gave her.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet one final time to find out what they have been paid. Joe Mallett and Alex Rea Baldwin kick things off by confronting Matthew Bracegirdle and Liam Halewood about their comments regarding the cleanliness of their establishment, and Jackie and Paul Langshaw complain about their poor breakfast score.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Cameras follow Tina and Colin as they choose between investing in a house in Yorkshire or taking the plunge and moving to the Alentejo area of Portugal.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Property experts Laura Hamilton and Jasmine Harman help a couple decide where to purchase their dream B&B. Yvonne is drawn to the Yorkshire Dales, but Omar would prefer a warmer climate in the Algarve, Portugal.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Litlington, Cambridgeshire: There's a Villa Here Somewhere.
programme.desc: The team heads to the Cambridgeshire village of Litlington to search for the remains of what was rumoured to be one of Britain's biggest Roman villas. However, the initial digging site yields little useful evidence, forcing the archaeologists to ask for permission to excavate local residents' gardens, while a team of diggers tackles trees and undergrowth in a nearby copse.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team search for the remains of an Iron Age fort at Dinmore Hill in Herefordshire, but their investigation is hampered when the geophysicists struggle to find target sites for excavating - and heavy rain causes further difficulties. With digging temporarily suspended, the experts discuss the purpose and date of the archaeology, but disagreements soon arise.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Documentary following life at Scott Miller's veterinary practice in Richmond Hill, south-west London, beginning as he tends a cat that has fallen three floors.(n)

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The architect meets a woman who wants to build a shop and a mobile home out of an old horsebox on a budget of just £500, and a couple creating a holiday let from a 1960s milk float. He also visits a remarkable 100ft-long balancing barn and makes plans for a rectangular pod for his tree house in the grounds of Northumberland's Kielder National Park.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs Revisited
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud returns to Somerset to see Ed and Vicky Versluys and their cow shed conversion. A year after his last visit and with the house finally complete, Kevin finds out what it's like living in an off-grid home designed for animals.(n)

programme.title: Volatile Earth
programme.desc: The impact of the Great Hurricane of 1780, which killed almost 28,000 people across the Caribbean, and the possibility of another of its kind striking again. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Wildest Weather
programme.desc: Footage of unusual weather conditions recorded in Britain during 2016, and exploring the factors that led to these incidents. The programme features footage recorded by people caught in the middle of floods, super-storms, tornadoes and lightning strikes, as well as a look at how a record level El Nino effect altered Britain's weather.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Cameras focus on the ups and downs of family life and how people pull together to get through them. Among the patients is Pam, 53, who is admitted to A&E after suffering a suspected heart attack. There's also a profile of 10-year-old Cora, who is rushed to St George's after being thrown from a horse into the branches of a tree.(n)

programme.title: Unlocking the Great Pyramid
programme.desc: It marks one of the greatest engineering enigmas in world history: how exactly did the builders of the Great Pyramid of Giza manage to lift limestone blocks of 2.5 tons each a distance of nearly 500 feet off the ground - without the advantage of modern technology? That riddle has inspired generations of historians and researchers to comb every interior and exterior inch of the pyramid, measuring distances and amassing data to arrive at a conclusion. But only recently have more definite answers come to light - answers that originate inside of the Pyramid. The documentary program National Geographic - Unlocking the Great Pyramid discusses this arresting theory(n)

programme.title: The '80s: The Decade That Made Us
programme.desc: Lift Off. This landmark new series takes viewers back in time to see how the '80s created our modern world. The first episode of this six-part miniseries explores the revolution in personal entertainment brought on by Pac-Man, Sony Walkmans and Jane Fonda's ground-breaking workout video. Apple's Steve Wozniak helps explain how Bill Gates saw the future by selling IBM the rights to use MS-DOS software for a relatively small one-time fee, only to clean up when IBM competitors entered the market and all wanted the same software. The assassination of John Lennon heralded the end of one music era, while a bratty new kid on the block defined a new one - spelt 'MTV'. Revel in the joy of July 1981 in Britain as more than half a million people line the streets of London - and another 750 million tune-in around the globe - to see Prince Charles wed Lady Diana Spencer. And, hear from maverick businessman turned multimedia mogul Richard Branson on how he took Rock 'N Roll to new heights - literally - with the acquisition of his first 747. Sharing their first-hand stories are Darryl DMC McDaniels, Steven Tyler, Jane Fonda, Steve Wozniak, Richard Branson and Princess Diana's private secretary(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs

He investigates some of the subcontinent's deadliest reptiles, including the king cobra and saw-scaled viper, and explores the natural history that has led to this epidemic.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Swansea.
programme.desc: Nick Knowles travels to Swansea to meet 15-year-old Jack, who suffers from a rare form of muscular dystrophy that has led to a lifetime of painful operations. His mother Helen and older brother Daniel do all they can to help but as he grows it has become impossible to get him upstairs and now he has to sleep in the living room, leaving the rest of the family with nowhere to socialise. Having heard of their plight, the DIY SOS team turns up to transform their three-bedroom semi, backed up by an army of local tradespeople, with designer Gabrielle Blackman on hand to ensure they don't stray too far from her vision.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun

Hetal and Mitul are convinced they have a balanced diet, but the fact they put a litre of cheese sauce in a moussaka and add chocolate to a health shake suggests otherwise. Once they learn the shocking truth of what they are really consuming, will they be able to stick to a strict regime?.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute

programme.desc: Part one of four. Earth is invaded by unscrupulous alien telemarketers, Hermes loses his head in a limbo contest involving sabres and a code tattooed on Fry's backside reveals the key to time travel. With the voices of Billy West and Katey Sagal.(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Part two of four. The alien invaders start looting history and order Bender to kill Fry. Meanwhile, Leela's relationship with Lars continues to bloom - with unexpected consequences.(n)

programme.title: Ross Kemp: Extreme World
programme.desc: Ross Kemp heads to South Africa, 20 years after apartheid was lifted, only to discover that a new set of problems exist, such as a widening gap between rich and poor. However, as he enters the deprived township of Diepsloot on the outskirts of Johannesburg, he discovers an even bigger crisis. Rape has reached epidemic proportions in the country, with statistics showing one in two women born in South Africa will be attacked in their lifetime. Meeting victims and perpetrators, he asks how attitudes to women can change, and what the government can do to curb this abhorrent crime.(n)

programme.title: Ross Kemp: Extreme World
programme.desc: Ross Kemp visits the Central American republic of Honduras, where he makes his way to the city of San Pedro Sula. With a rate of 169 homicides per 100,000 inhabitants last year - an average of more than three people each day - Sula has the dubious distinction of being the most dangerous city on the planet outside of a war zone. Ross discovers how armed drug gangs have taken over many parts of the country, forcing thousands to flee north on a freight train that transports migrants through Guatemala and across Mexico into the United States. But it's an arduous journey and not for the faint-hearted. Even if passengers avoid falling off the roof of the train to their deaths, they face being robbed by bandits, raped, murdered or kidnapped and sold into slavery.(n)

programme.title: The Guest Wing
programme.desc: Documentary following stately home owners who hire out their estates to earn extra income, and the clients who pay to use their properties for functions including stag parties, weddings and hunting trips. The programme explores how the reality of life in Britain's grand houses is often less glamorous than it appears, as proprietors struggle to maintain crumbling buildings and pay utility bills, and examines the modern-day divide between domestic staff and their employers. Featuring life at Chillingham Castle, Maunsel House, Carlton Towers and Muncaster Castle.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor tours the rooms, restaurants and bars where the rich and famous have lived, died and fallen in love, checking in to Bastille's L'Hotel in Paris where Oscar Wilde spent his last days. He travels to New York's Chelsea Hotel, where long-term residents included Mark Twain, Stanley Kubrick, Edith Piaf, Sid Vicious and Robert Mapplethorpe. Richard also heads to the Dorchester in London's Mayfair, where Britt Ekland shares her memories of meeting and falling for Peter Sellers there in 1964.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor uncovers the gossip, intrigue and scandal lurking behind the closed doors of some of the world's most famous rooms and suites. He visits the Chateau Marmont on Hollywood's Sunset Boulevard, where Howard Hughes famously holed up in the penthouse, Jean Harlow and Clark Gable carried out a torrid affair and Lindsay Lohan was recently temporarily banned for not paying a bill. In New York, he talks to former mobster Louis Ferrante about a robbery at the Pierre Hotel in 1972 in which cash and jewellery worth $10million was stolen.(n)

programme.title: Storm City
programme.desc: Ben Fogle presents the documentary exploring the devastating impact of extreme weather, finding out how destructive high-speed winds can be through a series of spectacular reconstructions.(n)

programme.title: Storm City
programme.desc: Four-part documentary in which Ben Fogle explores the devastating impact of extreme weather, finding out what happens when man is pitted against the power of Mother Nature. In this edition, he focuses on floods and the damage they can cause.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: As China and Kazahkstan hover on the verge of war, Santos works on his campaign strategy. Ellie prepares for her wedding, while Abbey greets the guests, but President Bartlet is held up by his duties. Carol shows up on the scene, and Josh's job is threatened by disgruntled party loyalists.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: The vice presidential debate between Leo McGarry and Ray Sullivan looms but Josh remains unconvinced of his candidate's abilities in the public arena. Meanwhile, Santos visits his family in Texas where his brother threatens to cause a stir.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: The winner of a makeover reality show disappears. Jack and the team learn she was a plain-faced book-keeper who suffered from depression before plastic surgery transformed her into a celebrity. As inquiries gather pace, they try to identify a man's voice heard on her answering machine. Anthony LaPaglia stars.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.sub-title: The Case of the Cross-Dressing Carp.
programme.desc: A teenager saving money to fund a sex change is found stabbed and hanging from a tree. The victim's phone leads the team to a hydrologist the youngster had been helping - but before they get a chance to interview him, he is also murdered. Meanwhile, Ronnie is excited at the possibility that her latest case could be a 1960s Mob hit.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Emotions run high for Danny when a woman he promised to help following the deaths of her parents commits suicide. Meanwhile, the Reagans suffer a devastating loss. Starring Tom Selleck, Donnie Wahlberg, Bridget Moynahan, Will Estes and Len Cariou.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: In this edition the actor explores the luxury hotels of Hong Kong. Home to more skyscrapers than any other city, he first checks in to the Mandarin in the financial district, before experiencing the Four Seasons, the only hotel with two Michelin three-star resturants, as well as the timeless Peninsula in Kowloon, which even provides a Rolls-Royce airport taxi service. He ends his stay at the Ritz-Carlton, home to the world's highest swimming pool.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: The Westins visit Washington, but it appears Doug is harbouring a secret from Liz that many of the other senior staff members already know. Meanwhile, CJ attempts to make a deal with the French in a bid to tackle problems in Sudan, and Josh asks for help with the campaign. Steven Eckholdt guest stars.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: The White House is thrown into a state of emergency by the threat of an exploding nuclear reactor, which also plunges the presidential campaign into disarray as the candidates struggle to deal with the situation. Meanwhile, Kate monitors the threat of conflict between Russia and China.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: Part one of two. The team searches for a mother who has disappeared, leaving her three-year-old son with a babysitter. While it initially appears she cracked under the strain of maintaining two jobs to support herself and her child, further investigation reveals she may have been drawn into the drugs trade as a mule, so Samantha goes undercover in a bid to snare the trafficker who recruited her.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: An actor becomes the victim of an axe murderer and suspicion falls on the studio bosses who could make huge profits from publicity surrounding the tragedy thanks to its similarities with several of their horror pictures. However, when Ronnie returns to the set to look for her mobile phone, she has her own terrifying experience.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods

programme.title: Criminal Minds

Jonny Lee Miller stars as the modern-day version of Arthur Conan Doyle's brilliant sleuth, with Lucy Liu as his companion Dr Joan Watson.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: As Hotch returns to work following his near-death experience, a woman is found crushed to death under a tomb-like structure in the Utah mountains. Meanwhile, Garcia prepares for her Day of the Dead party and pulls out all the stops to spook her colleagues.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team is summoned to Boston when three men are mugged and strangled to death with garrottes. A desperate thief is the first guess, but Garcia's discovery that none of the victims' stolen credit cards have been used makes the agents wonder if the killer is collecting mementos. Meanwhile, Rossi takes a trip down memory lane after hearing his favourite bar is on the verge of closing down.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Morgan returns to his Chicago roots to investigate a mass murder at an all-night diner. The shooter, a runaway teenager, has been killed at the scene by an off-duty police officer, but CCTV footage reveals he had an accomplice - who could strike again. Digging into the gunman's background for clues, the BAU finds no motive or criminal record. What drove him to kill?.(n)

programme.title: All About Steve

Romantic comedy, with Sandra Bullock, Bradley Cooper and Thomas Haden Church.(n)

programme.title: Miss Congeniality
programme.desc: A feminist FBI agent is sent undercover as a contestant in the Miss United States pageant when the event becomes the target of a terrorist bomb threat. As she is not exactly catwalk material, a veteran British coach is brought on board to oversee her transformation into a glamorous beauty queen. Comedy, starring Sandra Bullock, Michael Caine, Benjamin Bratt, Candice Bergen and William Shatner.(n)

programme.title: Miss Congeniality 2: Armed and Fabulous
programme.desc: FBI agent Gracie Hart is taken off active duty and made the face of the bureau's publicity campaign, but would rather catch crooks than be the focus of media attention - so when her friends are kidnapped, she disobeys orders to run her own undercover investigation with the help of a short-tempered colleague. Comedy sequel, starring Sandra Bullock, Regina King, William Shatner and Heather Burns.(n)

programme.title: Hot Tub Time Machine
programme.desc: A man suffering a midlife crisis tries to recapture his lost youth by going back to his old haunts with two equally unhappy friends and his teenage nephew. They end up being transported back to 1986 and are tempted to give themselves the lives they always wanted - despite warnings that they must not change anything. Sci-fi comedy, starring John Cusack, Clark Duke, Craig Robinson and Rob Corddry.(n)

He finds himself dealing with the hunt for a German spy as well as a female journalist sent to report on the exploits of the brave but bumbling soldiers. Comedy based on the TV series, starring Toby Jones, Bill Nighy and Catherine Zeta-Jones.(n)

programme.desc: A baseball player is stunned to learn he has come into a massive inheritance. Unfortunately, there is one condition - he must somehow find a way to spend $30million in just one month, or he will lose the lot. Meanwhile, two scheming lawyers, who stand to get the money if he fails, are determined to sabotage his efforts. Comedy, starring Richard Pryor, John Candy, Lonette McKee and Jerry Orbach.(n)

programme.title: Deuce Bigalow: European Gigolo
programme.desc: A low-rent lover-for-hire tries to raise the money needed for legal fees when his old friend and former manager lands himself in trouble with the authorities in Amsterdam. Unfortunately, a workers' union of gigolos is less than happy about his arrival in Europe. Comedy sequel, starring Rob Schneider, Eddie Griffin, Jeroen Krabbe and Oded Fehr.(n)

programme.desc: Premiere. Two guys make a pact to lose their virginity before their senior prom, but things take an unexpected turn when one of them comes out of the closet. Comedy, starring Nicholas Braun, Hunter Cope and Dakota Johnson.(n)

The patient is hugely impressed by the consultant's methods, leading him to follow the therapist on holiday, where he unwittingly proceeds to make his life hell while winning over his family. Comedy, starring Bill Murray, Richard Dreyfuss, Julie Hagerty and Charlie Korsmo.(n)

Romantic comedy, starring Richard Gere and Julia Roberts, with Ralph Bellamy and Laura San Giacomo.(n)

Comedy, starring Adam Sandler, Bridgette Wilson, Darren McGavin and Bradley Whitford.(n)

However, Bianca's would-be boyfriend thinks he has found the perfect man for the job in the shape of a quirky loner with a mysterious past. Comedy, based on Shakespeare's The Taming of the Shrew, starring Heath Ledger, Julia Stiles, Joseph Gordon-Levitt and Larisa Oleynik.(n)

However, the unlikely parents decide to give the relationship a try for their baby's sake, forcing Ben to face the challenge of accepting responsibility for the first time in his life. Romantic comedy, starring Seth Rogen, Katherine Heigl and Paul Rudd.(n)

Comedy, starring Dakota Johnson, Rebel Wilson, Alison Brie and Leslie Mann.(n)

Comedy, starring Amy Poehler, Tina Fey and Dianne Wiest.(n)

programme.desc: Five Green Berets stationed in Vietnam grudgingly undertake a bizarre mission - to help their native hosts by transporting a fully-grown elephant through 200 miles of rough jungle terrain. They soon hit upon a novel way of delivering the beast, deciding to load it into a plane, and then parachute it to its destination. Comedy, starring Danny Glover, Ray Liotta, Denis Leary and Doug E Doug.(n)

programme.desc: In a city populated by animals, a rabbit achieves her dream of becoming the first bunny to become a police officer - but faces prejudice at every turn. When the disappearance of an otter hints at a terrible conspiracy in the city, she enlists the aid of a con-artist fox in solving the mystery. Disney animated comedy, with the voices of Ginnifer Goodwin, Jason Bateman and Idris Elba.(n)
